Reviews.Title: “This property shames the Hilton brand”
Reviews.Author: christineMiami_Fl
Reviews.Content: Let me start by stating I stay in Hilton hotels at least fives times per month...all over the US and Europe. I have been to this property four separate times, and each has been consistently terrible. The ONLY reason I stay here while in Memohis is to continue earning HH points and stays. I should also note this is the first time I have ever bothered to write a review in reference to a hotel (or anything else for that matter); yes, it's that bad. Let's start with the hotel shuttle. Upon calling from MEM to request the shuttle, a rude woman will undoubtably answer the phone, ask for your reservation information (no other Hilton I know of does this), and will make you wait until the next shuttles leaves...in about hour. You might as well pay for a cab... Check in: long lines may or may not occur in this notably bizzarly designed and decorated lobby. If you are Hilton Gold or Honors, do not expect a better room or service...or for them to notice that you are a frequent customer. Room key: do not dare put it near your cell phone...or it will deactivate it. ROOMS: The carpet is filthy...in every room I've stayed in. Each room also had a drainage issue in the shower. I can't express how disgusting it feels to have the water full up to you ankles and to essentially wash in other people's filth. Also, the walls are apparently made of paper, because you can hear anything and everything your neighbors are doing. The glass is also thin, the nearby highway can be heard all night. There is essentially nothing good that can be said about these rooms...it's basically just a place to sleep...and everything feels dirty. The Restaraunt and Bar....OMG!!!!! Where to begin..... The resturant is like the twilight zone. Each time I have been, there have only been one or two parties present, and all are actively complaining about the service (rightfully so). Upon ordering a drink, you can expect 10 minutes of shear silence to go by ( there is no music or noise what-so-ever) until the waitress comes back and asks you to repeat the order. In another 10-15, they'll come with a lousy drink in a dirty glass. Tonight I ordered a meal from the "healthy menu". What a laugh!! It was pasta COVERED in pesto sauce to the point that it was ineatible. There was also supposed to be a full chicken breast...which turned out to be two small slices of what was obviously frozen ( dark) chicken. This cost $12 95. The waitresses and waiters have Ll been unprofessional and seemingly lazy. On my last stay, I ordered a salad from the bar (also about $13) it contained wilted lettuce , very, very little meat and was missing at least 3 other inclusions that the menu described. AND GET THIS: I had the nerve to order a Martini.... It came in one of those miniature martini glasses that you could buy for a quarter at big lots, was not nearly full, tasted God awful....AND COST 15 bucks!!!!! I live in downtown Miami, go out iften, and have NEVER paid more than 12 for the same drink (made 100 times better). Is this the outskirts of Memphis....or Manhatten?? What on earth are they thinking with these prices?? Club Level: A waste of time- the worst I've seen yet. And last time I was here, I walked in and out, had a cookie and a water...and the next day I observed a $9 alcohol charge!!!! It was taken off the bill, but still an aggrivation that took 20 minutes of an already rushed morning to solve. The strangest thing was that I never used my key or gave my room number to the attendent. Upon looking up the charge, the front desk person observed there was no guest signature...essentially some stranger just gave my room number and had my room charged....unbelievable. Basically, not only is this the worst Hilton I've stayed at, but one of the worst hotels I've ever been in in 33 years of living and a lot of travel. Next time I'm in Memphis, I'll likly forgo the HH points and stay at the Sheraton across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: zpb52
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have asked for a better experience than at the Hilton Memphis. We booked online for New Year's Eve, and added the romance package. When we arrived back at the room from the Liberty Bowl game, our bottle of champagne was waiting for us on ice. The lobby staff was very friendly and helpful, as were the restaurant staff. I realized after I got home that I had left my phone charger in the room. I called the hotel, and they said they had found it. I was going to be driving through Memphis again in a couple of weeks, and I told them I would be by to pick it up. When I got there, I met with the head of housekeeping, who had my charger waiting for me. THAT'S service! Despite its obvious age, the hotel has been kept up very well and maintains a very contemporary feel, all the way from the lobby to the guestrooms. It's a very tall hotel, and the elevators move at a very quick speed, so there's not a lot of waiting most of the time. Our room was on one of the top few floors, so we had a great view! Unfortunately, there isn't a whole lot to look at on this side of town. There are a few shopping centers and many dining options nearby, making the hotel convenient in that regard, but it is a good distance outside the city center and tourist attractions of Memphis. It's also completely on the other side of Memphis from Tunica, so expect a 50-minute drive (at least) each way if you want to go gambling. I would absolutely recommend a stay at the Hilton Memphis to anyone visiting the Bluff City.

Reviews.Title: “Would have expected better from a hilton”
Reviews.Author: ilovemexico99
Reviews.Content: Out of date and could be cleaner. Would have expected better/cleaner/nicer for a hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Gross!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Megan K
Reviews.Content: Very sorry to say that I was very underwhelmed by our stay! It didn't make our stay very enjoyable to find a dirt filled liquid back flow in the bath when the people next door used the shower or when we flushed the toilet!!!! Little was offered when we made the observation upon checkout.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel had everything I needed”
Reviews.Author: Doubleshot_Espresso
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay for a couple of nights while in Memphis. I wanted something reasonably priced, close enough to the airport, and where I could relax comfortably. The Hilton had all that and more. First of all, this was the most friendliest staff I have ever encountered in any hotel on the North American continent. (stand outs) The driver(s) to and from the airport were prompt, friendly, and dependable! Front desk personnel were there all the time and very helpful. The restaurant staff were on top of things and very service oriented. All the staff seemed happy to be there. The lobby downstairs is very open and relaxing. Nice place to just relax or wait for guest. There is a bar with attentive bartenders just in case you think to yourself "Why not have a shot of bourbon?" while decompressing from a day's travel. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The bathroom is smaller than most I have seen, but so what? It works and is clean. I must say I did turn on the shower without realizing the shower head was somehow turned out and directed toward my face like an hidden fire extinguisher. I was suddenly drenched and confused trying to figure out what was happening. LOL! After a few seconds, I realized the matter and simply turned the shower head back toward the "inside"of the tub. That woke me up and was just a matter of using two towels instead of one. The bed was perfect. The view was as panoramic as it could get considering the location. The little store was fully stocked with any sundries you may need, and more. Parking lot is wide open. You can tell this hotel really cares about it's guests and employees. No complaints. I will stay here again next time I come back to Memphis. Like another review, I did think the buffet was a bit overpriced, but then again, it is 'all you can eat' and can stay as long as they are bringing it out. I know because I asked. It was worth it. Here is a tip: It may take a few walks around the lobby to get used to the WC Handy statue just on the other side of the check in (as you make your way to the elevators). It is really cool with the background lights and all, but I was waiting for it to say something every time I walked by.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: RW_Adair
Reviews.Content: I was here for three nights on business. The rooms are large, the beds are very comfortable, and the bathrooms are spacious. Everyone I dealt with - from the valets to the front desk staff to the housekeepers - was polite and helpful. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paper Thin Walls!! Poor Renovations! Harassing Mgt. Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: Charlie W
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that the staff was amazing! They were very nice... unfortunately, my experience ended up the worse! This is a "remodeled" old hotel that NEVER received privacy walls updates. I stayed in the Presidential Suite, received noise complaints before anyone came... I was freaked out at how the neighbors heard music next door. The room was HUGE and the music was coming from a night stand radio!! The night manager harassed me... even after I turned it down. He stated that this room was for "meetings". I paid over $600.00 for the room and was harassed from the time I got there. It ended up a nightmare. There are a number of noise complaints and as nice as it seems you can hear everything from the shower in the other rooms to people talking in the other room.. even in the executive suites. They did NOTHING to fix these issues. The floors are somewhat slanted as well... almost a leaning tower. It's o.k. to stay there as a guest for one night on a quick trip but DO NOT use their executive suites or invite guest in your room. YOU WILL GET HARASSED! The walls are way too thin. Try the Westin or Hampton Inn downtown Memphis before you go here.. Oh yes and the floors were somewhat sticky..

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but a really good stay/value”
Reviews.Author: tamaragham
Reviews.Content: I don't agree with some of the reviews I've seen here. I got an AMAZING price for this hotel - only a 22 min drive from Beale Street but great locale if you're in town for anything besides that. I pulled up wondering "what's wrong with this place to give this price?" Honestly it wasn't perfect. The first night the revolving door wasn't working but the next day it was - I don't really care about that because I used the glass sliding door which in my opinion is a lot easier to use than revolving doors! We stayed in a suite on the top floor - the hotel was booked solid but I NEVER heard my neighbors like others said. My only complaint is that the A/C unit on one side of the suite didn't work but with the nice weather it wasn't an issue for me. The breakfast is not worth the money so don't pay extra to get it. Ask the bellhops for a good local place. We stayed two nights and for the price you pay (plus the Hhonors points) it is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton?!”
Reviews.Author: Bibiri
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on business trip for 7days. First, room seemed to be okay. But service here is POOR. I do not think room cleaning crew do decent work. You will feel that they just don't care about guests. And laudry service is terrible. You have to take dirty clothes to front desk!! Can you believe this??? At least I was told to do so when I found still-dirty-clothes in bag sits exactly as same way as it did in the morning when I left for work. I give them "Poor" rating though. Because the staff at restaurant was nice. Another hilton hotel in Mineapolis was good. I can not believe this is one of the famous hotel. Well, may be they don't want to work, since part of the fee goes to Paris. That, I can understand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the low price we paid”
Reviews.Author: Medianas
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit surprised over all the negative reviews this hotel has gotten. We stayed here for two days during February and everything went smoothly. Fast and friendly check in. Great big clean room with comfy beds. The bathroom is a bit small but since the sink is separate and outside it didn't bather me. Internet worked well. No smell of smoke like someone else mentioned and I happily walked barefoot on the carpet. The only thing that bather me a bit was the bell boy who wouldn't take no for an answer when I told him I could carry my own bag. In the end we just let him take our two suitcases. The parking lot is huge and free. It's not the best location if you want to visit downtown but the price made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel! Needs renovating, not non-smoking, staff doesn't care, etc.”
Reviews.Author: Michelle K
Reviews.Content: It is amazing that Hilton allows their name to be associated with this property. We traveled to the hotel for a dance convention last weekend for the third year in a row. The first year we didn't have any problems. Room was OK, room rate was really inexpensive and breakfast was included. All was fine. Last year they were completely overbooked. People who had made reservations months before were turned away. This year they overbooked again! I arrived at 3:30 to secure our room and 2 other rooms. The front desk staff said that the rooms were not ready. It is clear that they do not have enough cleaning staff to turn over the hotel in a timely manner. The girl took down my cell phone number and said she'd call when they were ready. Not a huge deal, we left to go shopping and have dinner at The Avenue shopping center. At 5:30 I called to check the status. The room wasn't ready. I called back again at 6:30 and it was ready. No one ever called me to let us know even though she said sheâ€™d call. We arrived at the hotel around 8:00pm. The bellman assisted us with our bags. As soon as we walked out of the elevator on the 5th floor the smell of cigarette smoke slammed us! He opened the room and it was smoky! I am a loyal Hilton Honors customer and have non-smoking in my profile. He patiently waited while I called the front desk to find out why I was in a smoky room. She assured me that my room wasn't a smoking room. I don't buy it! It was terrible and had cigarette burns on the carpet. Since the hotel was overbooked, there was nowhere to move us. We stayed. The next morning my daughters and I woke up with stuffy noses and scratchy throats. The Saturday morning front desk staff were very nice and understanding. They found new rooms for us & my 2 friends on the 4th floor. They offered us a nominal discount, the free internet code and free breakfast coupons. While they found new rooms for us, there was no one to clean them. I packed up our stuff in the smoky room and waited 5 hours for the new room to be ready. The new room had fresh air, but the carpet was gross. This hotel needs a top to bottom renovation in the building. Windows are drafty, condensation develops on the inside and drips onto the carpet and the sound from one floor to the next travels through the glass walls. You can hear what your neighbors above & blow are doing in their room. The ventilation filtering system is inadequate. Smoke from our neighbors bathroom flowed into our bathroom vent while we were showering. Carpets are dirty, cigarette burned and the pile is crushed. If I had babies or toddlers, I wouldn't let them play on the floor in the rooms. Breakfast buffet is OK when you have a free coupon, but not worth the regular price. Not a lot of selections and the restaurant is woefully understaffed too. On a Saturday morning with the hotel full, there were 2 waitresses for the entire restaurant. I actually called the front desk from the restaurant to tell them that it was understaffed. After making the call 2 front desk staff members were in the restaurant busing tables! We were at the hotel for a dance competition. The convention facilities are adequate, but the staging is too low and the sound systems are terrible. You can't see the dancers at all. If I was organizing a dance competition, I would NOT use this hotel. I'm sure there are better facilities in the area. This hotel is in a business district. I would not stay here if I was traveling to Memphis for the tourist attractions. It is off the beaten path. The only positive thing about this hotel is the parking is plentiful and FREE!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton lacks some maintenance but great on service”
Reviews.Author: RalphDailey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property many many times. It's always vibrant and full of people, sports teams or activities. The lobby is well presented with a sports type bar set up. Due to convention style rooms on the ground floor you'll find different activities going on, especially around the weekends. As a Hilton Honors and frequent guest, I'm always treated well by the staff. The building is a 27 floor round structure with great views as you go higher up. The executive lounge is on the 26th floor. As a frequent guest I have had countless maintenance related things happen. Call it bad luck but I'm always in different rooms. I've had mold in one bathroom ceiling, no hot water, water stoppage mid-shower, really cheap shower heads, torn shower curtains, plugged up toilets, hard to control air conditioners, on/off internet connections, broken lights and everything else I'm forgetting right now!! It's odd to me as room service is great, customer relations is great and nothing ever seems to be a problem when you interact with staff. This is what brings me back, yet each time something seems to happen that makes me grrrrrr about maintenance. Yes, I keep reporting it and who really knows if they fix it. Maybe they are moving me around to get a full report on all maintenance issues!?!? Worth the stay never the less.

Reviews.Title: “No one cares”
Reviews.Author: MemphisVis1t0r
Reviews.Content: The hotel changed owners and is even worse than it was before. There is no one on site who makes sure the staff does anything. Result? Staff does not do anything. The staff and managers are rude and unresponsive to criticism. No one seems to care that this is probably one of the worst hotels in a three-state area. We arrived with a reservation and Hilton Honors and left due to being sent to two dirty rooms. The staff and manager seemed unconcerned that we might leave. Hilton needs to get rid of this crew.

Reviews.Title: “Enthusiastic Staff, Not Alot of Character, Out of The Way for Tourist Stuff”
Reviews.Author: chuckm2003
Reviews.Content: Arrived very early in the morning and the staff was very welcoming and pleasant, allowing a no hassels early check-in at 11a.m. with no questions asked. The staff was enthusiastic with their greetings (kind of reminded me of the way Ritz Carlton staff behave) and gave good tips on getting to tousits attractions nefore my business meeting. But there in lies the rub. The hotel itself is off the beaten tourist path. Good lovcation for business in East Memphis but there are better places to stay closer to town. The workout room was well done with good quality machines but could have used a sauna facility. Perhaps most annoying, a $9.95 daily charge for internet in the room - come on Hilton you can do better than that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Gapeach525
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because it was one of the only ones in East Memphis that had a free shuttle to the airport. The rate was nice but the walls were super thin. They were very busy with some type of family reunion or conference and every time they came to their room, I could hear everything, so it was very hard to relax. On the other hand, the breakfast was great. I would stay here again, but I wouldn't stay on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: BigTraveller8293
Reviews.Content: Very nice lobby! Kinda hard to get to though. Not very close to the tourist places as well. Rooms are very nice and outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: skibuff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights for the Liberty Bowl Game between Cincinnati and Vanderbilt. The Hotel was the team hotel for Cincinnati. As a result, the hotel closed the Executive lounge (I am a Gold HHonors member) and made it the team HQ but they gave me two breakfast tickets and free wifi for both days as a substitute. Room was on the 16th floor and I heard no noise or other disturbances either evening even though Cincinnati won and it was New Year's Eve to boot. Room was very comfortable and the sleeping was excellent. The Hotel is a round Building with the core being the entrance to the room. As a Result, the exterior wall is completely glass with a good curtain for privacy. As i had forgotten my shaving kit, a call to Guest Services resulted in two kits of shaving goods and toothbrushes with toothpaste. The Guest Services staff was excellent, following up to make sure I got the kits. Met a lot of Cincinnati and Vanderbilt fans in the Lobby Bar area and everyone from both sides were extremely nice and I had lots of good conversations. I even went up to the Executive Lounge and was invited in for a drink and talked to some of the Cincinnati Coaches. Nice gesture by the team. The Hotel is on the West side of Memphis so it takes a bit of a drive to Beale Street, Downtown and the Stadium but since it was a good rate, not a big deal. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Has-Been”
Reviews.Author: FPodesta
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that this hotel was once amazing. It has been designed with the spirit of Memphis and Elvis in mind. The colors are vibrant and captivating. But, this Hilton has seen better days. Just walking in, one gets the sense that it's 1983. The round style hotel offers rooms with huge panoramic windows with great views of Memphis' mediocre suburbs. The bathrooms are small, but the sleeping areas are good enough. The hotel has a moat of sorts that is rather pretty. Breakfast is terrible. Food with actual mold is left out. Carb foods were stale. The service was friendly and helpful, but failed to make up for the lack of quality. Everything is generally clean, if a bit dated.

Reviews.Title: “Memphis Hilton - a good choice”
Reviews.Author: patj2
Reviews.Content: Service excellent - for our entire soccer team & parents! Room was good; breakfast delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff`”
Reviews.Author: migs23
Reviews.Content: The University of Cincinnatti football team was staying at the hotel along with family members and their entourages yet the hotel staff was not overwhelmed and was extremely friendly and helpful despite how crowded the hotel was. There was easy parking and the property is 20 minutes from Downtown Memphis and 5 minutes from Germantown.

Reviews.Title: “Pet-friendly and affordable. Terrible food.”
Reviews.Author: Marc H
Reviews.Content: This place saved us. We were traveling cross country with 2 dogs and could find NOWHERE in Memphis to stay. Even the cheap motels in West Memphis wouldn't take dogs. Luckily we located this place. So now, whenever we are in Memphis, we stay here. The "dog floor" has outside access....a dream come true. The staff is helpful and polite as can be, and the prices are good. There are a FEW problems. Every room we have been in has had a broken shower head (three stays, three broken shower heads). The breakfast buffet must be utilized very early in the day, because by 9 am the coffee cream is curdled, the bagels are stale, the yogurt is gone, the eggs have turned into styrofoam, and everything is ice cold...this is unacceptable...its not like this buffet is free. It's open til 11am but they never refresh it. That whole set-up needs to be overhauled.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising Place”
Reviews.Author: JJS3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 20-30 hotels in Memphis over the years, but never at this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised and intend to stay there again on future visits to the city's east side. Lobby was well and openly designed. The check in staff was cordial and very helpful. The room rates were very reasonable â€“ even below a Holiday Inn I was looking at. I upgraded to a suite (just another room that had been locked) for only $30.00. Valet parking was $8.00 per night. Food was reasonably priced. I did not see the â€œstandardâ€� extras you see in so many hotels these days. The room were pretty standard, but comfortable. Good bed. Quiet room. My business was conducted early and I got an early flight home. Even though I checked out at 2:00, they did not charge me for the extra night. In my rush to get out of town, I left two shirts in the closet which they mailed to me two days later. Bottom Line: I plan on staying here on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay but it might be time for a freshen up.”
Reviews.Author: Staff61
Reviews.Content: This is my first stay at this hotel after a recommendation from a co-worker. Unlike other reviews, i found the staff to be attentive and overall the service at the hotel was good. I did not get an opportunity to experience the restaurant at the hotel, as there are many great restaurants to chose from in the Memphis area. The room was clean, the bed comfortable but the decor seems as if it is a little outdated as compared to other hotels I've stayed in recently.

Reviews.Title: “Unfulfilled potential”
Reviews.Author: Gini B
Reviews.Content: I'm a Hilton diamond member who spends an average of 120 days a year in Hilton properties. I don't expect white-glove service, but it's business travelers like their diamond members who keep Hilton afloat, so I do expect some level of decent service from them. When I checked in to this Hilton, at the Hilton Honors desk, no less, I received virtually NO acknowledgment...no "welcome to Hilton", no "thank you for your loyalty," not even the crappy room-temperature bottled water. I was asked for my credit card, told where to sign and given my key packet. When I asked if there were breakfast coupons in my packet (I was on a government rate, which is supposed to include breakfast), he grunted, "26th floor hospitality room." Wow, dude, sorry to have interrupted you on your day off! One of my colleagues checked in at the "regular" desk and was being treated like a long lost relative. He got his water, breakfast coupons and warm welcome and he's a gold honors member. So it's obviously not a universal bad-attitude issue at this hotel. The room was perfectly average. As with every round hotel I've stayed in, the rooms tend to be a little more compact than conventional hotels...there's not much leeway when you're constrained by the hotel's architecture. With a round hotel, it's all about the view from the floor to ceiling windows. The furnishings were adequate, the bathroom was a split-model version (vanity and sink outside the door, toilet and tub/shower inside). Water pressure was decent. The lighting over the vanity was horrible...I think the sconces had 20-watt fluorescent bulbs in them and there was no separate vanity mirror, so I had to do my morning face-painting sitting on the bed by the window with a compact mirror. For cleanliness in the room, I'd give it a 7. The bathroom and beds were clean, but the carpet had little remnants of guests past here and there.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: thomas L
Reviews.Content: great hotel thanks to staff it was great me and my wife stayed there for a weekend getaway in memphis for a friends wedding it was a wonderful time i had a issue that when i told the hotel Attendant they took care of it within a hour wow! really wonderful people there. the wait staff at Rooks corner was so great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bshaw1211
Reviews.Content: I am a diamond member and found this jem in Memphis. Nice suite beautiful wall to wall windows, I will stay here from now on on my buisness trips to Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Convenient, but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: TJC22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short 10-12 minutes from the airport and convenient for getting around locally. The staff is very pleasant and helpful. However, the noise from adjacent rooms is quite loud. You can hear their TV, their conversations, their water running, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Cool architecture: tradeoff in convenience”
Reviews.Author: Charla
Reviews.Content: I've been driving by this Hilton for a couple of years; it's hard to miss (as you can probably guess from the photo!) I finallly got around to staying there recently and found the guest experience to be pretty much on par with any full-service Hilton. However, I quickly discovered that there's a tradeoff for that cool exterior, and it's all about convenience. For example, the entrance to my room seemed narrower than usual - not that the door itself was narrow, but the opening was partially recessed behind a flange in the hallway wall. Although I was able to maneuver it OK, that might make access problematic for someone with a larger frame or anyone using an assistive device for mobility. Furthermore, the room was sort of pie-shaped and seemed smaller than the average Hilton room. I assumed these were both architectural concessions to the circular footprint of the building. Also, there is really only one non-emergency entrance/exit at this hotel. That may not seem like a big deal, but given enough entries and exits you might change your mind. Plus, if you like to park close to the side entrance of a hotel during a multi-day stay in order to cut down on the walk to and from...as I do...you're out of luck. Plus, the hotel's main entrance is accessed via a dedicated driveway at the top of a slight grade on the long, expressway-facing side of the hotel grounds. The vast majority of the hotel's parking is at the base of that grade at one end of the driveway. With this layout, you're pretty much guaranteed a long walk from your car to your room every time you come or go. Luckily, the weather was great during my entire stay, but if it had been raining (or worse) this inescapble long walk would have made me REALLY grumpy. Given the layout of this main entrance, I can only assume that anyone in a wheelchair would have to be dropped off at the hotel's entrance and then made to wait while someone else parked the car. This is the first time I can remember being hesitant to recommend a hotel because of the layout of its grounds, but that's my takeaway on this one.

Reviews.Title: “A bit worn down, but ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: Thinker_to_go
Reviews.Content: For a Hilton, to be honest, you'd expect a little better. The room was ok. You have to be a contortionist to use the toilet and the curved architecture made for a relatively small room. Service was attentive and polite. For the price, I'd come back, but if I could splurge a little I might prefer to stay closer to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but problems with service”
Reviews.Author: Geert M
Reviews.Content: I'm not a complainer but this hotel stay was below average. I visited the hotel on business, and the hotel infrastructure was OK, but I had issues with the service in every department. Lengthy check-in, dirty bathroom, poor restaurant service, nobody picking up the telephone in room service, 25 minutes for an ice tea in the lobby bar; I started believing in the end that it was just me being impatient, but all my colleagues had the same experiences. To top it off, I took the time to write a letter to the hotel in an attempt to give some constructive criticism, and they never even responded. Overall, the hotel itself is OK; the rooms are nice and the food that (eventually) comes out of the kitchen is very good, but they need to address the service issues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and not too out of the way”
Reviews.Author: kingofthehill81
Reviews.Content: I went to Memphis for my 30th birthday. It was always a dream of mine to see Graceland. In looking for a nice and reasonably priced hotel we stumbled upon this Hilton. It is a littlebout side of town, but being with my family that was great! There is a lot going on downtown and not really were you want to be after dark with the kids, besides a quick car ride will get you anywhere you want to go. When arriving at the hotel were blown away as to just how nice the hotel was, it is beautiful! Heck in was speedy, but a little scary when they said we were on the 18th floor, seeing as how I am scared of heights! We got to the room and as scary as it was it was beautiful as the lobby and the full wall window was amazing! We as a family did enjoy the pool area as well. I would definitely suggest to any and all looking to visit Memphis to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice hotel but not great”
Reviews.Author: wick1979
Reviews.Content: On site personal were great, hotel grounds and area are beautiful. Only complaint is it is very far from downtown, but if you have a high enough room you get beautiful views of downtown on the horizon. Pool looked nice. Interior of the hotel is beautiful, but from room confiuration to interior of hotel you can tell that Hilton did not build this hotel. Walls are thin, elevators make strange noises when riding in them. Building is built with sub floors requiring all entry and exit a climb unless valet is used.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: VTbrooklyn04
Reviews.Content: Unique hotel. The rooms are not located off a straight hallways but circle around. I liked this hotel except for the incredibly thin walls and noisiness. While in your room, you can hear every single sound outside. Seriously. I don't know if the circular pattern affects this or increases the noise but it's bad. Someone beside me ordered room service and I opened my door BC I could have sworn they were knocking on my door! All in all, if you wear earplugs at night, good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Generic wannabe...”
Reviews.Author: Youneedavacation
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Memphis Hilton during a business trip mid-September. The overall experience wouldn't prevent me from staying there again but unless the location is convenient for your trip - I'd recommend staying at one of the nicer hotels downtown ( like the Peabody). I don't mind staying in a solid "business traveler" type hotel. In fact Hilton has two best in class brands in this category with the Hampton Inn and step-up Doubletree. What's frustrating is when you think you're stepping up to a nicer class only to find the Hotel going through the motions of providing any real upgrade in amenities. The "valet" doesn't appear to work after noon requiring major effort on hotel staff if the service is requested anytime other than first thing in the morning. Self-park. No bellman or concierge. The obligatory hotel bar seems like an afterthought tended by the night auditor who'd rather be home. The "free breakfast" in the hotel restaurant was very I-Hop. The room. My assistant booked it as some sort of upgrade but I'm not clear what was better. It was small with a king bed, desk, media chest and chair in standard semi- contemporary blah. The carpet was dirty - would have drove my wife insane. On the 27th floor - you have to negotiate 6-7 steps after you get off the elevator which is tough with bags. The bed however was extremely comfortable. From the mattress to the linens to the pillows - the bed rivaled any in a 5-star room. Just too bad the rest of the place does not match up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: travelchiks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 2 separate nights and both times had a good experience. Our rooms were clean and we slept well. The staff was friendly and efficient. We stayed one night on the 6th floor and another on the 7th floor and both rooms were great.

Reviews.Title: “Improved”
Reviews.Author: jtbeknott
Reviews.Content: The overall customer service at this Hilton has improved since my last stay several years ago. We had a room on one of the upper floors and the quality was better than the lower floors. Our room was quite large, and comfortable for a weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, extremely CLEAN and VERY comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dlmyvette
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night in July 2011 at the Hilton Memphis. This place was so inviting, I wished I would have stayed at least one more night. It was funny too because we happened to be there while there was an anime convention of some sort and had the opportunity to see all these ppl dressed up in costume. Most of the guests were teen and young adults but having them around didn't seem bothersome in the least. The hotel itself was clean, we found parking despite how busy the hotel was at that time. The room was amazing. So clean, the bed was a dream how comfortable it was and it was just so inviting. I loved the coffee bar inside the room and although we didnt have cups, we called and they brought cups within a few mins. I highly recommend this hotel, I would definitely stay there again, paid about $100 to stay there and it's not too far from the sites in Memphis either. Definitely need a car, it's not walking distance. And there is no fee to park at this hotel even BETTER!

Reviews.Title: “Not 1, 2, but 3 roaches and other grievances”
Reviews.Author: iknowquality
Reviews.Content: Oh, it was bad. Yes, three roaches in one night in our 17th floor room (all found in the bathroom). But that wasn't the only thing that was wrong. First, if you are a non-smoker, never accept a room on the 6th floor. When we checked in the room reeked and when we complained we were told that the 5th floor was smoking. No wonder. It was then they moved us to the 17th floor. Here are my complaints in no particular order: (1) the air conditioning does not work. The air blows but it is not cold. The thermostat can be set to 65 but the actual temperature never gets below 75ish. Fortunately we were in Memphis when it was only 85 outside. (2) They still charge $10/day for internet access - absurd. (3) There are almost NO useable outlets in the ancient rooms (4) No mini microwave or fridge (4) No free breakfast included (5) To add insult to injury, the restaurant does not open until 6:30 which is useless when you have an early business meeting (6) $4.50 for a 16oz bottle of water in the room (7) The carpeting in the hallways AND in the room was not vacuumed in days, if not weeks. White socks will turn black (8) In room lighting very dim and poorly place (9) And, oh yes, the roaches... To be fair, there were two staff members that went out of their way to help us during our abbreviated stay. It gave some humanity to a visit that couldn't have ended soon enough. The sad thing is that in checking out other Memphis hotels in the general area, none of them rated very high on TripAdvisor and other consumer feedback sites. Which leaves you sort of helpless and hopeless when forced to visit Memphis again.

Reviews.Title: “Reservations Check In and Check was the Worst”
Reviews.Author: sasha37682
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel over Labor Day weekend with a Bowling Guild for a National Tournament the Guild had approximately 300 rooms.(Room #1410) The front desk people appeared to be untrained and not prepared to check in this large of a group. We stood in line for hours and only one of the staff appeared to be able to keep the lines moving. There was only three people staffing the front desk on check in day. Check out day was was worst I checked out at 6:215 for an 8 am departure to try to avoid the long lines. I was shocked to find only one person on duty to handle the group of people that was checking out that morning to go home. Not only was the hotel unprepared they didn't have cash available to refund the guest money whom paid in cash for the hotel's $50 deposit. I was shocked and upset when the Front Desk Clerk told me he didn't think he had my cash refund of $50. The hotel was totally understaffed and unprepared to handle check in or check out. It was the worst service I have ever seen at an Hilton or any other competitior;s hotel. Some of our members didn't get their full refund because of lack of cash on hand. Lisa B. Room 1401. I have been on several charter and group vacations and never encountered anything like this....Very dis- satisfied and unhappy with this type of service.... Also the breakfast buffet I ate two days the pototoes were dried out, the sausage links not brown at all...the food quality was poor. I ate dinner one night is was okay but the lady across from me ordered roasted chicken that arrived to the table red and then when it came back it was over done. She did not eat at all that evening....did complain to the hotel restaurant manager. Another thing the hotel has spent alot of money to redo the room and hotel but my room carpet was so dirty and stained I didn't want to walk without my shoes on. It is a shame to redo the rooms and not the carpet...or at least clean them. I was shocked at this. You can tell alot of money has gone into the lobby , restaurants, hallways and room decor and then to leave dirty carpets...unimaginable.

Reviews.Title: “A great nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: younc024
Reviews.Content: first time at this place. Loved the room and very comforable bed. The only draw back might have been the very long walk from the parking area.

Reviews.Title: “Eugene the Bellman was AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie M
Reviews.Content: Our company recently held a conference at this Hilton. I asked the Bellman, Eugene, to unload 19 huge heavy boxes from 2 trucks and take them to our registration area. Temps were high 90s....poor guy got sweaty and dirty, and had to make about 7 or 8 trips, but he never complained. The smile never left his face and he came back regularly to see if I needed anything. I have never experienced service this nice. Eugene is a HUGE asset to this hotel! When you're there, seek him out! I was so impressed with him that I even found the General Manager and the Hotel Manager to personally sing his praises!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: arant
Reviews.Content: Check in was prompt. Hotel is circular so any room has good view on upper floors. Rooms are clean and beds are very comfortable . Hallway carpets always look dirty however the carpets are dark and shows lint easily. The Rook restaurant has good food and excellent service. Great value for your money. Grounds are very pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury and professionalsim”
Reviews.Author: ElsieDubya
Reviews.Content: We lucked out on Priceline to get 2 nights for $55 each night. However, that did not include internet. The pool is nice and large (to 4' depth), the service prompt and very courteous, and we had a huge room with a great view and very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some freshening up”
Reviews.Author: CosmoKitty24
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times on business trips to Memphis, and must say that i think it is now in need of some freshening up. My room was ok, it was clean, but the hallway outside my room just plain smelled. The walls had stains on them, and there was a musty smell as if the rugs had been wet and not dried out. I was thankful the walk from the elevator to my room was a short one. The breakfast that came with the room was what you would expect from a big chain hotel, however if you need to eat early, they really don't start putting the food out until 6:30-7:00 am.

Reviews.Title: “Overcrowded”
Reviews.Author: zowie007
Reviews.Content: WE booked three nights and there was a religiious convention plus two or more family reuions. I don't understand why they accepted my priceline bid other than the fact that anyone just walking in off the street would just turn around and walk out. I wish we had been aware of this because the lobby was extremely crowded and people even spilled out onto the curb. I would have like to have taken advantage of the fitness center, but when I returned to the hotel. I would go directly to my room. Parking was full most of the time and when you parked you had to walk a long way. i would probably try them again, but I would hope they don't have that many activities at one time.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, not bad”
Reviews.Author: Olif_10
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a third party (online) and got a REALLY good deal on it. Overall, I would say the hotel was 'nice' and I would not mind staying there again. Here is my breakdown: location- not bad, about 15-20 minutes to downtown, we did not run into any traffic, so it did not seem too long a drive; 4.5 out of 5 stars lobby- very nice and contemporary; 5 out of 5 stars Staff- very friendly; 5 out of 5 stars room- a little outdated and nothing spectacular, clean nonetheless; 3 out of 5 stars restaurant (ate there for breakfast)- again, nothing spectacular, but also not bad in any sense of the word, staff again very friendly- 4 out of 5 stars pool and spa- looked alright but we did not have any time to use it What else can I say, if I were to be in Memphis again and get this unbelievable deal on this hotel again (more than 50%off their hilton.com rate) I would not hesitate to stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent sales and catering staff!”
Reviews.Author: ClarkandEvenlyn
Reviews.Content: We recently hosted a business meeting/conference in this hotel and were so pleased with the level of service from the sales and catering staff that I wanted to leave a great review for them. My husband had an injured foot, and the staff went out of their way to help us get our equipment into and out of the room as well as our vehicle. Orlando is a real pro, and other members of his staff, Brandon and Greg, were so polite and eager to provide assistance. Mary, the catering manager, was also very professional and easy to work with to reschedule our event to their property when another hotel unexpectedly closed. We will always use this hotel to host events in Memphis in the future. Thank you Hilton Memphis!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed. Will not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth55197
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and housekeeping staff nice and pleasant. Front desk personal presented with bad attitudes, unfriendly and unwilling to help with small request. I have stayed at other Hilton Hotels. Hilton Memphis at Ridge Lake Boulvard, does not measure up to other Hilton Hotels or even Hampton Inns I have stayed in when it comes to treating their customers with a pleasant and helpful attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but beware of events!”
Reviews.Author: AngelofEbola
Reviews.Content: I had a room here for ABC, Anime Blues Con. The room was clean and pretty and didn't smell odd. The tv was a flat screen high def with HBO and normal tv channels. They also had a fridge in our room, which is normally extra but they didn't charge us. Now for the bad parts. The bathroom had mold in the ceiling, so be careful those with allergies. None of the ice machines were working, and not because everyone was hogging the ice. They just didn't function. This hotel has four elevators, which move quickly and have a window so you can look outside. But the second day I was there, two of said elevators stopped working. You had to wait and wait and wait for an elevator, and you never knew if it would be full or the idiots would let the doors shut (that happened not once but TWICE to us). All in all, location was great and the hotel was pleasurable. But ask in advance if anything big is happening, such as a convention with 600+ all trying to check out of their rooms on a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “not a recommendation”
Reviews.Author: bereca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night with a church convention with my 3 year old, 1 year old and my grandmother. I started a family late in life after traveling to a lot of different locations and i would have to say i would not want to stay in this hotel again. When i arrived at the hotel after a 4 hour drive with kids and a grandmother....i was greeted at the front door by the nicest valet i have ever met. He was great. I entered the hotel to check in and was greeted (and i use that term lightly) by a young woman who assigned my room. i had the kids in a double stroller and headed off to the elevators. When i arrived on the very top floor, there was a stairway to reach the rooms. I could not very well go up a stairway to get to a room with a double stroller that weighed easily over 75 lbs (with the 2 kids strapped in). I went back downstairs to the front desk where i spoke to 2 young men about the situation. They acted like i had just ruined thier day and I was told that the hotel was completely booked and they were not sure if they could change my room. I was asked repeatedly if i had been to the room because if i had they could not change my room because they could not resale it. After i had assured them that as stong a woman as i am, that i had not picked up that stroller and taken it up the stairs nor had i left my kids alone while i went to the room that the room was air tight and i either needed another room or 2 men to help me up and down those steps as many times as needed with that stroller. Finally, I got a room. The air conditioner did not work properly in the room and they came to fix it twice and it never really worked. i had the thermostat set on 60 and it never really felt cool in there. Admittedly, it was exceptionally hot outside....it is Memphis in June afterall, but the air should have worked better. If i had been staying more than 1 night i would have had to have a different room or they would have had to actually fix the problem. The room was a little on the small side, but it was only 1 night and i could handle it. The hotel set up was not very accessible for the stroller (or for someone in a wheelchiar). The church convention events were on the "P" level and the only way to get there was by escalator (which i could not use) or by elevator. In order to get there by elevator, you had to go down and walk through the restaurant and back around to reach the event rooms. Thank goodness they did not lock the restaurant doors. But again i was only there 1 night so it was ok. The highlight of the trip was the waitress we had in the restaurant for breakfast. Her name was Sandra if memory serves and she was exceptional. She was so accomodating and sweet. She was really good at her job and it is because of her that i did not rate this hotel a 1. Overall, I will choose a different hotel the next time i go to memphis. Memphis is in the heart of the south and the front desk staff was not a very good representation of southern hospitality. I dont travel as much as i once did (pre-children) but I do know a good hotel when i stay at one and this one was NOT the right fit for me.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be back”
Reviews.Author: Amy-STLMom
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through hotels.com. The rate stated it included the breakfast buffet. When we checked in with Blake at the front desk we were told that breakfast is never included when booked through a third party. I showed him my printout of my reservation that clearly stated that it was included. He said he was sorry but it wasn't included. After bickering back and forth I asked to speak to a manager. He said he would give it to us since I showed him my printout. He handed me a voucher. I asked him if it was good for 2 people. He said yes. As I suspected when we went to breakfast the next morning we were told that it was only good for 1. The only good thing is that the server Sandra was extremely helpful and called the front desk and cleared up the whole thing. The room was in good shape. It looked like it was recently renovated. The hallways were very outdated. The baseboards were held together with blue painters tape. Overall we did not have a good experience and will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Landmark Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ballard55
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel when it was newly built in the 70s. It was a wonderful hotel then, Today, it is even better than when originally built. It has stood the test of time! I live in Italy and have friends in Mississippi who go with me to the Hilton Memphis each year. This year we have chosen high floor rooms that conncet and are looking forward to spending our time in the hotel. Last year, we did the same. The staff is very professional and helpful in any way, in order to make a guest stay enjoyable. The Hilton is located in a wonderful area, safe and with many excellent restaurants. This trip, we plan on eating in the newly renovated Rooks in the Hilton. Thanks you for your continued excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “A Memphis favorite”
Reviews.Author: Tracelogix
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite Hilton hotels in the US. Great east side location and in the center of the business hub. The lobby is very unique and you just want to sink in the big leather chairs and relax. I had an egg white omlette that was excellent. Good value for the money. You can only make a great decision staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PastorMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while traveling for a wedding. The hotel was wonderful. The lobby was magnificent. The rooms were beautifully appointed. If I could, I would stay here every time I travel to Memphis!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ellajen
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Memphis at 9:30 in the morning after a long trip straight through the night with three kids from Wisconsin. The staff allowed us to check in right at 9:30 so we wouldn't have to wait until 3:00. The hotel was beautiful and very comfortable. Defintely would recommend. MAKE SURE TO EAT AT GUS'S FRIED CHICKEN and CORKY'S. Both were wonderful. We enjoyed Gus's so much we went twice. Didn't like that you had to pay for internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Great East Memphis hotel”
Reviews.Author: Advisor58
Reviews.Content: Although location is somewhat remote (in reference to downtown), this hotel is fantastic. Great views, clean rooms, and a friendly hotel staff. Stay here if you get a chance! Many restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “The Customer Service was Over the Top”
Reviews.Author: smithjohnth
Reviews.Content: My stay here was over the top. The staff and management were most accommodating. I had one issue upon arrival and the General Manager took the lead in creating a positive resolve. He also assured my satisfaction by engaging at least three other team members to assure complete satisfaction. I was most impressed by the General Manager's daily activites as he managed by walking around. He always addressed each employee by name (including the guy cleaning the carpet as he walked about). That level of interaction seemed infectious as I observed each employee in the performance of their duties. They all had a special care and concern for the customer. Provisions for our training conference were very nice and employees were always near to provided the extra necessities when needed. Special thanks to JaQuan, Chelle, Shavon, Sharon Brown, and Team Lead/General Manager Wm. (Bill) Spenser. This was the nicest hotel stay with training conference provisions that I have experienced in a very long time. Thank you, Thank you, Thank you. With the utmost respect and appreciation for all that this hotel provides and their commitment to customer service. John T. Smith, Atlanta, GA P.S. I did not take advantage of all the ammenities that this hotel provided.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: teqp
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times in my 4 trips to Memphis in the last 2 years. The hotel is fine, nothing special, just a clean room with internet access. The room I stayed in last was clean and did not have any bad smells. I would stay at this hotel again on my next trip to Memphis. I have not eaten at the hotel restaurant or lobby bar so can not comment on the food. After all when in Memphis it is time for BBQ!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Would Absolutely Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: tpitt11
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was clean and nicely decorated. The fitness room was fantastic. The rate per night was not overinflated, which was greatly appreciated. It is in the Germantown area of Memphis with tons of convenient stores (Target, Liquor Store, Sports Authority, Restaurants) all within a five minute drive. Very close to the highway and a quick 15-20 minute trip to Beale St, Union Ave, Graceland and all of the great tourist attractions. Plus, the bed was more comfortable than my own at home! This was an overall wonderful hotel. Just two things we noticed: better lighting was needed in the bathroom vanity area and an outlet near the nightstand would have been useful.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not be Tempted”
Reviews.Author: TheWanders
Reviews.Content: I travel for work and am a Diamond Level member of Hilton Honors and this has to be one of the worst Hiltons in the chain. The hotel is old and has not been updated, carpets have a dampness about them and the rooms have a stuffy smell to them. I found the doormen to be pleasant, but the staff at the check in counter to be uncaring. I have to travel to Memphis several more weeks this year but will not be staying at this Hilton. There is a Homewood Suites very close that is the future reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, decent location!”
Reviews.Author: super3bay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night while in Memphis for work. Hotel was nice, service was pretty good. Over-all a decent stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Dancer10_11
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel in connection with a major dance convention. They were un-accomdating and completely unprepared. They "reserve" rooms based on floor preference then give your requested room away to the first guest that checks in and asks for it regardless of whether or not there was a prior request. So basically when they record your room preferences they have no intention of actually honoring them. Furthermore, they did not have enough towels to distribute, the elevators are too few and extremely slow (our group was forced to use stairs to rooms as high as the 12h floor all weekend) and several guests had their cars broken into overnight. The room was hot and the walls were paper thin. We heard every movement including our neighbors who had to change rooms at 12:00 AM. The Hotel is is dated, rooms are stale but the real problem is the management.

Reviews.Title: “ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: laserlady_10
Reviews.Content: I found the service to be good. I ordered room service and it came in the time frame quoted. Food was not that good though. The front desk staff was knowledgeable and helpful. We got the water bottles and caramel corn too which I though was great as I drink lots of water. Had a leak by the window and put a towel over it and it was left there so the room had a bad smell. My water bucket was never emptied and never got a new bag. I even threw it away hoping to get a new one. Nope, had to use a plastic grocery bag. The breakfast buffet was good. I enjoyed having eggs cooked to order and the pecan waffles. The best part is that it came with the room rate. The room was a good size as was the bathroom area. Nice flat screen tv. The carpet was worn and had a few stains. Always pack some slippers. The walls were pretty thin, could hear tv in other room and partiers coming in late. About 12 miles from downtown, but close to Germantown.

Reviews.Title: “Hopefully won't return...”
Reviews.Author: lissyanna21
Reviews.Content: Antiquated furniture and fixtures are the first thing you will notice, and the musty odor is the second. The deadbolt on the door adjoining my room with the neighbors was broken, so the door stayed partly open the entire time (it would not close all the way). I ordered room service, including hot tea, and the food wasn't spectacular, but since I was starving I ate it anyway. The "tea", however, was a silver carafe that 1) burn my hand with scalding hot water because the top was stuck and 2) apparently was a dirty, used coffee carafe (complete with leftover coffee) that someone just poured some hot water into (yes, the "water" that poured into my cup was dark brown, and not because it already had a tea bag in it). The carpet in the room was filthy and stained, and even the end tables and desk and little bits of crumbs, dirt, dust, someone's old hair band, etc. The bed linens were old and very yellowed (note to housekeeping: if you want to keep the age of white bed linens a secret, don't stick one pillow with a bright white pillow case next to three with old, yellow cases). The walls were so thin I could hear every word of my neighbor's phone conversation (and he was definitely not speaking loudly) and every footstep in the hall. The phone at my desk was broken, but thankfully there was another on the bedside table. All in all, definitely not worth the cost, and next time, Hilton, don't spend all of your money on the waste-of-space lobby with the ill-placed bar while leaving your guest rooms looking/feeling/smelling terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Physical property OK, indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: JimInBoulderCO
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times now and have mixed feelings. The property itself is fine. The location is in a suburban office park with many restaurants and other shopping a short drive away. It's not a great location to walk anywhere, though, unless you are working in one of the nearby offices. As a Diamond member, you'll receive a small paper sack at the front desk when you check in. It'll have two bottles of water and a snack. (Mine had caramel corn this week.) I thought this was odd, but I guess it lets them assign you a room when you check in rather than having to deal with preassigning rooms. I've yet to be greeted as a Diamond guest, or to be welcomed back as a returning desk. Although my Hhonors profile requests a room on a high floor, I'm typically placed on the 9th to 12th floor of this 27 floor property. There used to be an executive lounge on the 26th floor (according to prior posts on Flyertalk about the hotel), but it's no longer open. I took the elevator up to the floor to take a look, and there is a set of double wooden doors where it's clear a lounge used to be located, but they're locked up tight now and there are no signs. Very disappointing for a full-service Hilton. Since there isn't a lounge, you do get breakfast coupons. The breakfast buffet, though, was probably the lousiest I've ever encountered in a full service hotel. The selection was poor, and the quality was mediocre. I'd rate Hampton Inn's breakfast higher. Service was terrible too...I was served one small cup of coffee, and the server never stopped by to see if I needed a refill. When she did come by, she dropped the bill off, didn't ask if I needed anything else, and scurried off. I headed to Starbucks (not in the hotel, but nearby) afterward. As a Diamond, the Internet is free. It's unusual in how they manage the charges though. A code is printed on a sticker placed on the key envelope, and you must enter this code in your Web browser (under "promotion code") to get free access. If you lose your key envelope (as I did) and sign in as a "normal" guest, a charge will appear on your bill. (The front desk removed the charge, though, on request.) You must enter the "secret code" daily. Parking is free. There is a charge for valet parking, but valet parking isn't really that useful at this property. All parking is outside. Housekeeping is spotty. I fill the ice bucket every night. I've yet to have the maid empty the melted ice bag and replace it with a new one...I always have a "bag of water" to deal with when I get back to my room. I've also frequently encountered dirty water glasses left behind on night stands or by the sink. There is an Hhonors check in desk, but no one pays any attention to it. (That's typical though for SPG, Hilton, and Marriott at most properties.) The key and key packet are the same regardless of status. The rooms have LCD TVs. (The nearby Residence Inn and the Memphis Marriott on Thousand Oaks Boulevard still have old-style tube TVs.) Except for the LCD TV at the Hilton, I prefer the Marriott on Thousand Oaks Boulevard. That hotel does have an executive lounge, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The staff at the Hilton is very indifferent. And, the only recognition of status at the Hilton is that small paper sack with two bottles of water and a bag of caramel corn.

Reviews.Title: “We will never stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: CJR36
Reviews.Content: Checked in to stay at what we thought was a quality motel. Rooms looked nice but the walls were paper thin. We had to attend a seminar the following morning and attempted to go to bed around 10 p.m. The traffic noise was loud, but tolerable. Our neighbors were evidently there to party. They screamed and laughed from the time we arrived till around midnight. We called the office and complained twice. We finally fell asleep around 1 a.m. We were woken up by our porn star neighbors around 2 a.m. I am suprised everyone on that floor did not here them. We called and complained again. This went on for hours. There was no way we could sleep, it sounded like they were in our room. My husband explained this to the clerk the next morning during check out but they refused to give us a discount or even appologize for our inconvenience. We arrived at our seminar the next morning on about an hour of sleep. I will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “NO ROOM AT THE INN...Sorry bout your luck!”
Reviews.Author: wfepse
Reviews.Content: Hilton Honors member...Diamond VIP level...booked the room 3 days in advance...check-in is 3pm. We arrive at 3:45 to be greeted with a lobby full of unhappy guests. Luggage everywhere and nobody smiling. Go to check in kiosk and are greeted with..."our housekeeping staff is running late and we have no rooms ready, have a seat and we will let you know when one is available". Not hello, good afternoon, kiss my butt...nothing but., "no rooms, sit down, shut up and wait". Okay...lets try the Honors approach...so I have this card that tells you (front desk clerk) that I stay at Hilton hotels 150 days a year, we need a room now, can you help...we need to be at a meeting at 5pm and got to get changed. Nothing. Try the Manager approach...can I speak with your manager...and get, "manager is not available so please take a seat". Try the forget it approach...okay, no rooms ready, we will go the Mariott down the street...and still no help! Love Hiltons and all their chains. First bad experience with a Hilton in a long time! But this one...never again! Not a second chance for this place! No, I can't comment on rooms or food quality...never got to try any of them and staff seemed far less interested in me and the rest of the guests waiting than I have ever experienced. Bottom line...she could have offered to store our luggage and point us to a bathroom...but ney, ney,...Sit down, shut up and wait! Not me!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in a loud, frat house-style circus, this is your place”
Reviews.Author: chilly_mcman
Reviews.Content: Received an unrequested wake up call at 5:00 a.m. They called multiple times and then sent someone up to knock on my door, saying I hadn't answered the wake up call. After this I couldn't get back to sleep because I had no choice but to listen to the next door neighbor's t.v. through the paper thin walls. In all fairness, they comped the room (as they obviously had to), but when I asked them to do something (anything) else for the inconvenience they told me they couldn't. Horrible service for a business supposedly in the hospitality industry. I guess the Hilton name doesn't imply anything these days. If I wanted to be woken up in the middle of the night and then have the front desk blame it on a glitch in the system, I could pay $100 less somewhere else (where they'd probably have free internet and breakfast). Don't stay here. The previous week the sounds of the highway coming through the window all night mixed with the fire alarm randomly going off made me not want to stay. Also, the way the hotel is laid out, when people leave their rooms in the early morning, the doors slam **VERY** loudly, and you can hear it crystal clear. Overall the loudest, least restfuly night I've had in a hotel ever. Upgrade to the Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “average, in need of a renovation”
Reviews.Author: Clinker1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three weeks on a business trip. Lobby is a bit noisy. Kind of a silly place to put a bar. Perhaps with an interior redesign they could improve all of that. The place is in need of some design updating and renovation, carpets worn, walls & doors scuffed up, etc. It has alot of potential. Overall the rooms are clean, my room on the top floor (27th) had a black carpet stain. I did see a huge cockroach by the elevator door on the 27th floor one night which I promptly killed. But I didn't notice anything unclean that would cause an infestation. The room was of adequate size for me. I noticed several carpet stains throughout the hotel in hallways. The location was ideal for me with a car. I had easy access to the city loop (I-240) and stores and restaurants were a short distance away. The service was friendly but sometimes unreliable. This seems to be due to staffing shortages. One person at the front desk at times when more were needed. Sometimes room service would take longer than the ETA given. I had one room service lunch that took over an 1 1/2 hr. When they finally showed up they did not charge me for the meal without me even asking. When I would call to have my laundry brought up, sometimes they were a no-show and I would have to go down and get it. Restaurant food & service were good but I only ate breakfast there. Room service menu was limited and average although the steak was nice. Bed was decent, I slept pretty good. I really like the full wall view windows facing the outside. Although, I suspect some might not like that design. I would recommend this place if their service was more consistent and the renovated and upgraded the place. Until then I would have to recommend the Homewood Suites or Embassy Suites nearby.

Reviews.Title: “We would NOT stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: remnant53
Reviews.Content: The staff was not friendly at all. It was very LOUD (bunches of people in the lobby). The hotel was dirty and the room smelled. We wanted to stay at the Embassy Suites down the road but, they were full so, we were given this hotels number instead. It was definitely not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hilton Needs a major renovation.”
Reviews.Author: mike1742
Reviews.Content: this is a circular hotel when you see those you know you are in for it. the lobby is gorgeous! The hotel tower is old, dirty and needs renovation. Skip this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: mcghee911
Reviews.Content: I spent the night of my honeymoon in hilton hotel memphis. Enjoyed all the qualities that accompany a five star hotel but, the customer service was insufficent. After leaving the hotel, I realize I left my blue tooth and charger. My initial response was to try to retrive it from the room but was told that after check out no one could return to room, and that I needed to wait 24 hours and call to see if was located. As I was arrived to my next destination something about that sounded strange so I called back a spoke with someone in management. I was then told they located my blue tooth and I could pick it up. When I arrived at the hotel to pickup the blue tooth, no one could locate it. Needless to say from that date March 28th to now August 16, I am still being tossed around telephone call after telephone call, trying to come to a resolution. I realize at this point it is no longer about the blue tooth its about the principle. Large hotels gloat in accomodations but lack in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Actually a very nice stay...”
Reviews.Author: ngwife2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Memphis July 19-July 22 for business. I was weary of the hotel because of all the negative comments I had read. It was actually a pretty good stay. I had a room on the 11th floor (even though I had requested a "high" floor, that's the highest room they had when I checked in). It was large, well stocked, and clean. Daily housekeeping was great. The beds...WONDERFUL. I hadn't slept that well in a long time! Even though one whole wall in each room is a window, the room still stayed cool. I did notice the walls seemed kind of thin, but luckily, I had quite neighbors. The food served in the on-site restaurant was very very good. You can't beat the "All you can eat" lunch for $9.95! All staff that I dealt with were very friendly and helpful. The fitness center was great (TV's on all equipment. Can't beat that!) The only thing that bothered me is that I was there without a car and there is hardly anything within walking distance...BUT...the free shuttle runs a 5 mile radius. I'd stay here again, and not think twice about it!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, spotty to poor service.”
Reviews.Author: GritsAndGucci
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Memphis Hilton for a weekend getaway in June 2010. Our experience was somewhat up and down. The ups: we were, on our request, upgraded to a suite, which was nice. The suite itself was quite nice, and on a high floor with a decent view. The downs: the service was VERY hit or miss. Even though it was a Saturday night, and there was a wedding taking place in the hotel, they appeared to be woefully understaffed. Bellmen and valets for the car were nowhere to be found, which resulted in us being quite late to our dinner reservations across town...and this was in spite of calling the front desk TWENTY MINUTES ahead of time to request our car be brought around. Although we were never unpleasant or demanding, despite having several very annoyed moments during the weekend, the front desk staff was brusque and off-putting, and generally had an air of being put out to have to deal with guests...or with us, at any rate. We also found that the power outlets in the suite's bathroom were inoperative, and thus we were unable to use hair drier, flatiron, etc...AFTER we had showered, were unclothed, and were trying to race to get to dinner. Perhaps not a big deal to a male guest but for a woman trying to dress (quickly) for an elegant night on the town... Catastrophic! Aargh! Room service was a bright spot. They were fast, efficient, and the breakfast was quite good. Overall, though, definitely NOT up to the level of what one expects at a Hilton...or any mid to higher quality hotel, really.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking and comfortable but noisy...”
Reviews.Author: sens1992
Reviews.Content: We stayed at he Hilton memphis for one night. The hotel is far from downtown Memphis (20 minute drive) but it is located next to Interstate 240 so it is convenient for travellers. The hotel looks very good. It is a modern building with a huge lobby. The room was pretty large and the furniture fairly new. The bed was comfortable. One thing was that we could hear everything from room next to us. It was not like the guests in that room were loud or anything but it has to do with poor soundproofing... You should not be able to hear the conversation from another room in a Hilton property.

Reviews.Title: “$99 a night sounded too good to be true...and it was.”
Reviews.Author: hotel_guy_24_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel, upon arrival, is actually very beautiful as is the lobby. However, that is pretty much the only good quality I can think of in describing this Hilton property.When I made my reservation, I listed in the comments section that we were staying there for my birthday. No mention of that was ever made by any employees at check-in or check-out and there were no special amenities. As someone who is an employee in an historic boutique hotel, I know that special touches are what makes a guest's stay memorable. There was nothing special about this hotel. Check in was just a process with no real greeting and at check-out we were treated just the same. We never valet parked (we used their free parking) yet we ended up having to pay for one night of valet as that was the only night they could take off (it was a 2 night stay). And no reason could be given as to why we were being charged for something we never used. I also faced issues at check-out with incidental authorization charges that should never have occured. Again, I work front desk in a hotel so I know what I'm talking about when I say that this hotel DID incorrectly charge me. And no attempt was made by any of their staff to resolve those issues. The room itself: while it was 15 flights up and had an amazing view of Memphis, the wall separating our room and the next guests were PAPER THIN and we could hear EVERYTHING. With a pool being 15 flights below you'd think you wouldn't be able to hear all the screams and yelling coming from there. But guess what? You can. Overall, the best part of my stay in Memphis was when we WEREN'T at the hotel. Never recognized by staff. No real convenience. And no accuracy in billing. This is not what I expected from a Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Every Room is a Sauna ... Bad Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: chasquad
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton located in Memphis, TN. There were a couple of issues. While the hotel seems nice and pleasant (the lobby is great). The room was super warm and the in-room air conditioning system was not able to keep up with the heat. I believe that the heat is due to the large reflective windows present on the hotel. The other issue was with Rook's restaurant. It was very scarey as we were there for dinner and we were the only people (other than the staff) there. In general, the food was not indicitive of the price paid. I would recommend a restaurant makeover in the near future as this is such a great location and has so much potential.

Reviews.Title: “Good meeting venue”
Reviews.Author: EastlandMall
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a business meeting group. Impressed overall with food and meeting rooms. Guest rooms small but efficient. Staff was very friendly, particularly in the restaurant. Hotel has interesting landmark architecture. Good fitness center. Cons: Benihana is the only restaurant within walking distance, printer in business center not working.

Reviews.Title: “Valentines/Anniversary Almost Ruined”
Reviews.Author: M-Town901
Reviews.Content: This was my anniversary gift for my wife. I purchased their Valentines package which included a high rise room, champagne, dinner, and breakfast. Sounds good right?.........I called ahead to see if we could check in early. The girl who answered the phone had an attitude and stated no early check in was available and check in time was 3pm. We got there around 3:30pm. There was a line with about 6 or 7 people ahead of me. It took them about 20 mins to check in each person. Once I got to the counter, I was told that my room was not available. Ridiculous! He offered me a lower level room; I declined because I specifically requested a high rise room. I was told to wait about 20 mins and to check back with them. 20 minutes later, my room was still not ready. I asked for manager.
