The manager stated that they were understaffed and my room was still not ready. She apologized and stated call me when it was ready. While waiting for my room, I talked to other guests and they were having similar issues. I think there were about 15 people in the lobby waiting for there room as well. Around 5:30, my room was finally ready. Once we got in the room, I thought it was nice. It wasn't the room I reserved online and my champagne was not in the room. I went back to the lobby and requested my champagne that was suppose to be there already. I kept the room because I didn't want to go through the hassle again. Dinner wasn't too shabby. The menu was very limited. The next day our bill was delivered to us. I found out that they charged me full price for the room that I didn't get. I called the front desk and was told they would correct it. We had breakfast in the room and it was actually good. After checking out I went to the front desk to get a reprint of my bill. The manager stated that it has not been corrected. I waited again for her to correct my bill. I recently checked my bank statement and they still charged me full price with an extra charge that I don't know about. I'm about to call them to see what's going on...........RIDICULOUS!!!! Worst hotel experience ever!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Staff in MY 59 Years”
Reviews.Author: Hiltonwho
Reviews.Content: Arrived at check out line at 4:00 PM with a 3:00 PM check in time. Only 3 of the 4 kiosks were manned. 1 of these 3 had a young lady who was gone more than she was at the kiosk. Reached a kiosk after 40 minutes in a long line. Was told I had a reservation (made about 3 weeks earleier) but no rooms were available. They took my cell phone number and said they would call when a room was available. They explained they had not had time to clean alll the rooms. Posted check out time is 11:00 AM. I explained to the clerk that this was a Valentine's Day weekend outing with 5:45 PM dinner reservations. We wanted to shower and change before dinner. She suggested that we change in the lobby restroom. I asked to speak to a manager explaining that we could change in a restroom at a gas station. We paid for a room at a Hilton. Ballancia Hayes, supposedly a manager, came out but offered not assiatance except to promise that I could get my room key from her when we returned from dinner. We received two phone calls during dinner telling us our room was ready, one call for us and one for a Mr. Tanner. When we returned at 8:00 PM. Ms. Hayes was talking to a couple at the kiosk (for about 18 minutes). We were in line behind them. When she finished with the couple, she simply turned and walked back into the office. I asked rather loudly to the other 2 clerks at the kiisks if I could get keys to the room that I should have had at 4:00 PM since Ms. Hayes was not providing service. One of the clerks came down and provided keys. We finally got a room after our un-showered dinner. The key envelope said a bill copy would be under our door by 5:00 AM. If it was satisfactory, we could leave our keys in the room. When we left at 9:30 AM, no copy was there. When we reached the lobby, a porter with a luggage dolly followed by a large female tattooed employee with a tray, shoved the dolly through the door at us before we could get out. The female employee looked at us oddly and asked what floor. We said lobby if you can let us out. The porter moved the dolly over just enough to let us through the door. I left the keys at the check out desk and explained that we did not get a bill copy under the dooor. The female at the check out desk replied in a loud sarcastic voice, "I'm sorry! Goodbye! Have a nice day" Rather than argue with another rude employee, I left without a bill copy. I fully expect to argue later with a fouled up billing --- like everything else. The porter at the door was polite. One other elderly porter near the check in desk was polite. Every other hotel emplloyee that I encountered was a rude as I have ever experienced at a hotel. Atay at a Motel 6 if necessary. Do not subject yourself to this hotel. The building is nice. It was a favorite of ours when we were younger at the hotel was under different ownership. Our stays since Hilton took it have found horrible check in situations and rude employees but nothing to compare with this visit. Our younger memories of this as a special place are gone. We will never stay at this hotel agaon. They need to fire the manager, clean house on employees, and start over from scratch. A hotel is far more than a building and facilities that you were fortunate enough to buy from someone else. I would suspect that the positive reviews on this page were entered by hotel staff to camaflouage the other experiences similar to ours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnotherHoustonian
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The lobby is really cool and the rooms are wonderful. The mattress is super comfortable. The decor in the rooms is modern, hip and very neat. We were only here for one night and I would absolutely have loved to have stayed longer. Check in was smoothe and easy. The staff was helpful, quick and very nice. My room was on the 23rd floor and the view was fabulous. This hotel is the whole package. Very cool!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Lobby....”
Reviews.Author: gregkapas
Reviews.Content: Excelent Lobby, other than that-fair.Half inch dust on side of sink counter,mold stain on wallpaper in bathroom...stain on the carpet..... FAIR......

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stay was pretty Good...except....”
Reviews.Author: Incognita1
Reviews.Content: Like others have said the hotel lobby and fountain were very beautiful....the conference rooms were very nice.....but for the price the rooms were ok. I was expecting the rooms to be just as nice as the lobby ambiance was. We asked for a room on the lower level to say time on waiting on the elevator to go up and down to higher level rooms. Out side of the Hotel it is POSTED THIS IS A SMOKE FREE HOTEL!!!!! Well guess what wrong!! In side of the hotel lobby and other places were smoke free. They gave us a room on the 4th floor as requested...but they failed to tell us that the SMOKING Floor was the 5th floor. Can you say that the smoke was flowing in our room throught the vent as if we were smoking. It was so bad I called the hotel front desk to ask that we not get charged the room smelling like smoke. We are both non smokers we thought we could deal with the smoke smell, but it was so bad I asked that we get another room. At first the gentle said that the hotel was totally book because of the conference...but I was persistant in moving that he "found" another room above the smoking floor. The rooms in this hotel are small and cramped. The bathroom was very small and the tolet was so close to the bathtub that you had to be careful not to fall in it. The water did not flow from the shower head very well. The carpet looked like it needed to be cleaned. I will have to say the beds were confortable. Over all it was ok for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Lobby, Fair Everything Else”
Reviews.Author: DaveLD
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is striking. It is very open with a beautiful fountain in the center. Unfortunately, that is the best feature of the hotel. I was there for business purposes and found the meeting room I was in to be in poor shape. Like previous reviewers, the price is probably a bit high for the quality of the room. The rooms are arranged in a circular pattern around a central elevator. The room was not very clean and certainly not the quality I expected. I did enjoy the view from the room although there is not much to be taken in from this area. I did not use the pool or fitness center but they looked nice. No free internet in the room. I do not remember the exact price but I think it was pretty steep. I had lunch in the hotel restaurant (forget the name). The turkey club with fries was pretty good. If you can get a good deal at this hotel, it would probably be worth it. But I would not recommend it if paying the full rate.

Reviews.Title: “I have found a new hotel to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: diamondluv4life
Reviews.Content: Was a bit concerned about staying here after reading some of the reviews about this hotel and after the bad experience about the prior hotel I stayed in while in Memphis. But after looking at a room before I paid for it, I was glad that we gave the hotel a chance. The hotel staff were very helpful and warm during our check-in and during our entire stay here. The room was perfect. Very roomy and to many amenities to list. Let just say that I normally stay at Marriott Hotels, I now have a second choice in hotel stays when I go on vacation. I liked it so much that I have an upcoming trip to Atlanta. I have already booked my hotel stay with Hilton Hotels. After reading the reviews for this hotel they were completely off and I know that I am the worlds pickiest person.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Mazda3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as this was the hotel my husbands company was paying for. We read the reviews prior to going and wasn't sure what to expect. Overall the service was just fine. We had the bellmen drive us around a fair bit and they all were very friendly. When we checked in they gave us a room with two double beds and when I called down to say they made a mistake that we wanted a room with a king bed they changed it for us. The room was clean and a good size. The breakfast buffet was average, the service was always with a smile and the lady making your fresh omlettes was very friendly as well! We arrived late and ordered in room service and the food was okay..nothing to write home about, but good enough none the less. Would I go back and pay myself to stay here, likely not. I think you can find a better deal at other hotels. Oh, the gym was also pretty good and kept clean. Liked the fact that they will drop off and pick you up at anywhere within 5 miles. Also liked the fact the gym was open 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “the WORST service”
Reviews.Author: steve123mem
Reviews.Content: as people have said before 'never again' the service couldnt get any worse. staff was rude and not helpful, you just get the run around. stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: FatherHinie
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 3:00 pm for check-in. The line wo register was to the front door (and it's a big lobby.) Only two of the four registration desks were open. After finally getting to register we were told that rooms were not yet ready but they would call us when they were. We headed for Beale St and the National Civil Rights Museum (recommend highly.) Having not recieved a call to say the room was ready we returned to the hotel at 6pm. Our rooms, 313 and 314 were ready. We proceeded to the elevators. Once aboard the elevator we searched for the number 3 on the panel. There was no 3! As we rode to the 22nd floor wew were finally able to read a small sign that said the looby is on the 3rd floor! Ugh. The rooms were very nice. Good size and clean. Later in the evening we went to the lobby for a cocktail. Four bar drinks were $53 with tip. In the morning we ate breakfast at the buffet in the basement. Very very limited selection, long wait for coffee, cold food, and very overpriced also. When I returned home I discovered a charge for $103 on my credit card that should have been $67. I left a couple messages on the voice mail for the accounting department. After no responses, I left a message for the hotel manager and called the national customer service number. The customer service rep told me they would give the hotel 3 days to straighten it out. I received a call from the hotel manager the next day. That aftewrnoon I received a call from a man in accounting who said he would check into it. The next day i received a call from a rep in the accounting department who said she was returning my call from the voice mail I left ( two weeks earlier.) Finally the first person from accounting called back and said they would credit my account and that the "system" somehow magically charged my account for more. He claimed it did not happen to anyone else. I will never stay at another Hilton. There is no excuse for such poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “overall good”
Reviews.Author: IowaJustMe
Reviews.Content: Beds were extremely comfortable, with down comforters on top and bottom. Pillows were good and did not give me a stiff neck. Loved the view from the room and the lobby is very attractive. Only downside was there was no refrigerator in the room, and the air quality was rather dry. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but service was a bit spotty”
Reviews.Author: creamezodapop
Reviews.Content: The location was a bit far from downtown, but it suited our needs just fine because we were going to an event closer to east Memphis. One of the top selling points was the free parking. All the downtown Memphis hotels were significantly more expensive and you had to pay parking fees on top of that! If you do not have a car, I would not recommend staying at this hotel. But, because we did have our own car, it was a great deal. The room was clean, and they even included non-down pillows as I requested (although there was 1 down pillow, but I just tossed it aside). The shower pressure was much too hard. I felt like I was being pelted, so be careful when you step into the shower here. Overall, the hotel was quiet and relaxing. We even had a room right by the elevators, but did not hear any noise from the elevators. The service was a big hit-and-miss. We arrived after the check-in time (3:00 p.m.) and yet were told that our room would not be ready for another 10 minutes. The front desk area was a bit chaotic and disorganized. It seemed like there were plenty of workers, but they did not necessarily know what they were doing. The bellmen were very attentive though.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: tink35
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst experience I have ever had. I stayed here for a three day vacation to do some sightseeing. I arrived on a Friday morning and checked in using my debit card for the room. By Saturday morning when I went to use my debit card, my card was declined. When I called my bank to find out why my bank informed me that the hotel put a hold on my account THREE different times and various times on Friday for the total amount of the room for the three days. I had three holds on my account for $476 each. When I went to the lobby to explain to them that they needed to remove the other two holds on my account they informed me that there was nothing they could do because thier accounting department was not open on the weekends. The staff there was ignorant and dismissive and could care less that my vacation was being ruined because I was not able to access any money because they charged me three times. I spent 4 hours in the lobby on my first officail day of vacation trying to get this resolved. As I write this, the issue as still not been resolved. Along with this, I was supposed to have breakfast included in the package that I booked. All three morning I had to go down to the front desk and have them remove the charges becasue they kept charing my breakfast to the room even though it was included. On my last night there I went to rent a movie and couldnt, when I called the front desk they told me they had no credit card on file for me!! Amazing considering they charged me THREE times for the room. The room was only cleaned once, the second day room service never came at all to clean the room. I can easily say that there was not one person there who had any kinowledge of customer service, all were rude and ignorant. Do yourself a favor and stay clear of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “way too loud”
Reviews.Author: davieboyArkansas
Reviews.Content: Our first night, the people above us made so much noise that sleep was impossible. I think the rooms are poorly insulated or something. It sounded like people were right outside our glass window. Numerous compaints to the front desk didnt do any good. The next day we were moved to another room. The people next to us were so loud we couldnt sleep for hours. Its not that they were so loud, the walls were just so thin or poorly sound proofed it seemed that way. As a business traveller I've been in a lot of hotel rooms, its not often I've had such a rotten stay.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Classic”
Reviews.Author: gift2menashville
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a great weekend in Memphis, TN. I was in town for the Southern Heritage Classic Football Game between Tennessee State University and Jackson State. The Hilton hotel stay was great - the rooms were very clean and had alot of space which was well worth the price that I paid. The staff was also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “LOOK FOR SOMEWHERE ELSE TO STAY!”
Reviews.Author: WP777
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HIlton this past weekend (October 2 and 3, 2009). My room was not clean! It had dust piled up on the dresser. I found trash on the floor underneath the bedspread. The rooms are not luxurious at all, even after I hear they have done recent renovations. The room temperature was not good or easy to adjust. The food was so-so. I expected way more from a Hilton property! Parking is horrible as well!

Reviews.Title: “Very upsetting...”
Reviews.Author: ghaem
Reviews.Content: Where to startâ€¦first of all customer service is extremely poor. It sounds like the staffs are not obligated to any responsibilities. Our room was dirty. The bath tub was filthy with hair all over. The hotel looks good and tempting in internet add but if you want to have a good time in lobby and the bar of the hotel, please do not choose this hotel. You will be not only disappointed but very upset. There are several hotels around the area with the same price and so many amenities that this hotel does not exhibit.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jimpilch
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was a little trepidatious about staying here, however my fears were unfounded. The room was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The food was good as was the service.

Reviews.Title: “Not where you'd want to stay for a week at all”
Reviews.Author: Kimpee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week for a convention. I thought from booking my managers in the Hilton all the time, that this was a quality hotel. Maybe when you have the Hilton Honors point you get a better room. However, because I was part of a convention of 500 - 1000 people, maybe they just did whatever. Sadly, I found the following dissatisfying qualities: * I was in a room with my two kids, and our room wasn't being cleaned every day until another family member mentioned it to housekeeping. * When my washcloths and towels were restocked, they would only put two washcloths and towels to replace the dirty ones they took. It was 3 people in my room, so clearly I needed 3 washcloths & 3 towels daily (if not more). Guest services said that since another convention ahead of ours had "problems w/ removing the towels / rags and taking them to the pool" that if we needed additional rags other than the 2 they initially bring, then we would need to call the front desk each time there was a need. * I called the front desk to get more towels / rags, and warned front desk that I may not be in the room, but for them to still have someone bring them in. Left room for about 4 hours and came back - still no clean rags / towels. * There was NO complimentary internet service in the hotel rooms. If you're going to be a 3 - 4 star hotel, how can you not have complimentary internet service for your customers? That is not good. The only available area to use computers was the business office, and that was only for emergencies or visiting professionals. So, you couldn't just use the computers in there for an extended period of time. * The ice machine on my floor was broken for the first 3 - 4 days of my stay. I guess they felt there was no need to rush and fix it. I hope this is hopeful for someone. I thought the Hilton was something like the Marriott Fairfield, etc. The Fairfield "does" have complimentary internet.

Reviews.Title: “A little worn around the edges.”
Reviews.Author: deanrob101
Reviews.Content: Quick one night stay at the Hilton Memphis. Lobby has been refurbished and gives a nice wow as you enter the hotel. Front desk staff is very friendly and did a good job reviewing the features of the hotel. I am a Hilton Diamond member and was offered an upgraded room, free internet and complimentary breakfast buffet; all of which were greatly appreciated. Room was showing some age and wear and tear-especially in the bathroom. Bedding and flat screen TV (my 2 most important items) were very good, but the old, small bathroom really took away from the rest of the room. I enjoyed the breakfast buffet and it has a good selection of both healthy and non-healthy (but really good tasting) food. Restaurant service was a little spotty as I had trouble flagging down the server to settle my bill. If this hotel were the only place in town it would be okay. However, there are many hotels close by, including an Embassy Suites, that would be a better choice in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Fully Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jmarkw
Reviews.Content: There are several hotels within walking distance of this hotel. Choose one of those. The list of negatives are numerous. First: The room was dirty. The floor not vacuumed. The shower moldy. The fixtures in need of repair. A dirty wash cloth in the shower. etc. Second: The air conditioning never cooled the room. So we just sweat all night. Third: Only one "partial" roll of toilet paper. Fourth: There were at least 50-75 unsupervised kids and teenagers in a 3ft deep dirty pool from the time we checked in until the pool closed. Fifth: The elevators were very slow, taking as long as 10 minutes to go up or down. We were on the 10th floor. Sixth: The parking was way to far away from the hotel and way too dark at night. Seventh: The staff was less than helpful, with the exception of the housekeeping staff member who had to bring us a roll of toilet paper late in the evening. Bottom line... you would expect far better from a Hilton. We were scheduled to staty at this Hotel again this week when coming back through Memphis... No Thank you. We'll choose another...

Reviews.Title: “Great looking but details overlooked”
Reviews.Author: Leadbelly98
Reviews.Content: Both the exterior view and the hotel lobby of this tall Hilton property are great. So it provides a wonderful first impression and sets high expectations for the rest of the hotel. However, attention to details is lacking in several areas. Highlights of the hotel 1. Magnificant exterior view and impressive lobby 2. Flat panel HDTV in the room 3. Friendly front desk service Shortcomings 1. Rooms are dated with visible wear & tear in the bedroom and bathroom 2. Restaurant is under-staffed and service is below average 3. Fitness area is not tiny but it is too small for the size of the property.

Reviews.Title: “class”
Reviews.Author: mrbrownstown
Reviews.Content: the hotel is impressive when approaching from the road and doesnt disapoint when you enter. it is a beautiful hotel and really enjoyed our stay. it is located outside the city centre so if you are planning on heading to beale st or other tourist places you will need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LizzChicago
Reviews.Content: I am a very loyal Hilton Honors member and have gold (almost diamond) status with them so I was disappointed when I stayed here. The first issue I had was that I checked in late one night and had to walk very far from my car in the dark parking lot to the main entrance to the hotel. I did not feel safe. My room was not up to the Hilton standards I am used to. The TV was old and I even had issues when I ordered a movie. It would only show it in B&W. I had the staff in there to check it but they could not fix it. They didn't offer to remove the charge. I had to asked for it to be removed upon check out. Room service took a long time but was good quality. I had materials delivered to me and they could not locate them for at least an hour. Overall it was not a great visit. The other issue I have is the length of time it takes to get from the parking lot to your actual room. I am in sales and have to come and go through out the day in between appointments. It would just take me too long to park, walk to the entrance, walk to the elevators and then wait for the elevator. There are other hotels in the area that I would recommend over this one. I know always stay at the Embassy Suites on Shady Grove.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time had”
Reviews.Author: orlandodiva
Reviews.Content: we went to memphis for a few days stayed here rooms very nice beds lovely breafast and lunch was very good breakfast is buffet style kids ate free, staff very friendly, cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Worse out of 100+ Hotels i stayed at...”
Reviews.Author: SaltShaker09
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel for me was like dating a beautiful blonde girl with nice body, amazing legs and chest and beautiful face, but her attitude sucks and she is bi$%y! The hotel itself was very nice, the lobby was gorgeous, and the exterior of the hotel was beautiful too. As far as the rooms go, they were average. The TV was nice, has some HD channels. The training facility was nice too, all equipments were in working condition and clean. The breakfast was very good too, because of my Diamond VIP status I got free full buffet, so that was good for me... And now to the customer service part and the hotel staff; to put it plainly, the hotel staff at this hotel was bunch of incompetent people that had no idea how to do their job. Here is what happened in my case. I check in with my gf, and after 10 minss, thee front desk person gives me my room keys for room 2704. So we go up to room 2704, try my key cards 10 time each, but they donâ€™t work. So I go back to the front desk, and it turn out he had given me the wrong information, my room was 2613 ( but they put your keycards in a "Sleeve" sort of thing, and the printed room # on that was 2704). So I go to 2613, key works and we go in. I asked to get somee extra coffee, never recieved it. about an hour later, my girl was in the shower and I was in my boxers working on my laptop, I hear a knock on the door, and as I get up to go open the door, the door opeens and some lady hotel employee walks in and hands in my gift( because of diamond VIP I get some small basket with water, choclate etc). And the lady never apologized for just bursting in my room. I was like WTF?!?!?so anyways, we go to bed and fall asleep. And then I wake up to the sound of someone breaking into our room, I dont know if we're trying to get robbed or something, but I see the guy thats trying to enter the room, he had his suitcase and travel stuff with him. It then hits me that they probably made the same mistake with him. It turned out he was on the 25th floor nott the 26th, BUT THE SCARY PART WAS THAT THEY HAD ACTUALLY GIVEN HIM THE KEY TO OUR ROOM!!! inmy case, my key didnt open to wrong room, but in his case, they gavee him the wrong room, and HIS KEY WAS ABLE TO OPEN OUR ROOM!!! needless to say , we couldnâ€™t sleep till like 4 in the morning. I woke up at 5:30 to go to the fitness center, after I was donee with my workout (around 6:15am), I went to the front desk to let them know what happened. The first Lady I talked to ( I think her name was Marciella or something like that), and her response was basically " SO?", "what do you want me to do about it"? so I toldd her I want to speak with manager. she told me the manager wont be in till 8:30 but I can talk to the supervisor ( I think only her job title was "Supervisor", but in actuality it was "blind leading another blindâ€� sort off situation). So I talked to the supervisor, I told her what happened, at first she seemed helpful. I told her I want the room changed, because I dont know how many others have keys to my room. shhe agreed, she told m she has a room available, and while I go have breakfast, she'll do the paperwork. So we have breakfast, go pack up my stuff in my room, go ddownstairs to get my room changed. Again,( that Marcielala or Marshella or something like that), I talked to her, and mind you, my room shouldd have beeen ready by now, she peent 10 mins doing something on her computer, and I kept telling her what the holdd up, but she never answered. At that point I was likee F^&$ it, I just left my luggage with her, told her im gonna go attend some work I had to do, and that she can just have thee bellman take my luggae to my room when it because available.(this is around 7:30 am). I get back from work around 1:00pm and ask for the keys to my new room, and it turns out, I still didnt have a new room. The person I talked to was a Columbian girl, and out of all the incompetent employees, she was by far beetter than all of theem ( but still not so great). So I still didnt have a room, they had assigned room 2714 to me, and the lady was cleaning the room ( mind you, my new room should have been ready by at least 7am). so I literally stand there for 30 mins, just waiting to get my room cleaned, and meanwhile, the supervisor that I talked to this morning, she comes as well. She says as a result of what happened, she can take the charge for one night off of my hotel stay ( a value of $100+). I told her that it woulddnt do that mucch help to me, because my company pays for it, so it doesnt matter. she said she can give complimentary dinner for me and my girrlfriend. Sounded good. The hotel food was expensive, we didnt but the most expensive stuff on the menu. I got a steak entre', and she got Buffalo wings as room service. Theey brring us the food, but only silverware for ONE person. im like WTF, we order TWO entres and just get one set of silverware and glass of water? and on top of that, apparantly, the complimentary dinner was valued at $40 ONLY, and thee ffood came out to $60 ( yeah that expensive for just regular entre plus the buffalo wing), so I had to pay the rest out of my pocket. Again, I was like WTF!?!?! theey were willing to give me hotel night off (value of $100+ ), but in exchange they tricked me into a complimentary dinner for 2 ( but NEVER said 40$). in the past 2.5 years, I hav stayed at 100+ hotels and maybe 300+nights of hotel stays, and never had I encountered such a bunch of incompetent staff. and its not like one or 2 of the emplyess were incompetent, its turns out MOST of theem were bad.... Anyway, this is the last time I will stay here (I actually checked out early and stayed elsewhere)

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, bad customer service, yet expensive - in a word: Horrible”
Reviews.Author: NeenerNeener
Reviews.Content: I've read some of the recent reviews giving this hotel an "Excellent" rating, and I wonder if those people stayed at the same place I did. I'm a Hilton Hhonors VIP, so I have a minimal standard expectation of a Hilton property. This one missed the mark by miles, even when accounting for the generally substandard level of customer service one finds in Memphis as a whole. After arriving, I spent the first 35-40 minutes of my stay trying to get the hotel staff to give me a room that had been properly serviced by housekeeping. The first room had been smoked in, despite the hotel's non-smoking policy. The second room had beds that weren't made at all. The third room's bathroom had obviously not been cleaned - there were icky remnants of the previous guest in and on the toilet, and there was also a large, very noticeable buttprint in the bedspread of one of the beds. The fourth room didn't have anything horribly wrong with it at first glance (although I was to find out later that my first impression was incorrect), so I stuck with that one. During this entire ordeal, I never received a single apology from the front desk staff; nor did they do anything about the fact that I was carting my luggage back and forth and up and down during all the room-changing fun. The rooms weren't the only thing that needed cleaning - the hallways and elevator lobbies were strewn with trash, and looked like they hadn't been vacuumed in a month at least. This, despite my stay being in the middle of a work week. The "high-speed" wireless internet service was $10/night, but it was actually low-speed, and dropped several times during the evening. Room cleanliness was marginal, and I found that housekeeping had taken several shortcuts, forgotten or overlooked things, and had done things that I found disgusting: - Ony one of the beds had been recently serviced - the other had dust and crumbs on it. It had obviously been untouched in quite a while. - Numerous items were overlooked - there was no shampoo, only one washcloth, and only one large towel. This was in a 2-double-bed room! - There was a partially-consumed bottle of water on the TV stand, with the "you will be billed $4 if you drink it" tag still attached. - The coffee cups for the in-room coffee maker smelled exactly like the room's complimentary bar soap. It was clear that the coffee cups had been "cleaned" in the room with bar soap, probably used soap left by a previous guest. I called Guest Services to ask them to address these issues, but the person who answered the phone spoke with an accent or speech impediment that made him impossible to understand. I have lived in many parts of the world, and have spent numerous years living in the Southeastern US, but I could not understand a word this man said. I can't imagine what would cause Hilton to choose this staffer to answer phones. I tried to explain to him what the issues were, but I could not understand his responses. We ended the call with me unsure whether he was going to do anything to resolve the problems. No one ever showed up to fix anything, so my question was ultimately answered. The only thing positive I can say about this hotel is that it is right off I-240, which makes it easy to get to. I will not ever stay there again, and I strongly recommend that this place be avoided. Again - I wonder if the people posting recent positive reviews stayed someplace else, and confused it with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay in Germantown”
Reviews.Author: Litl1
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks great from the outside but the rooms are filthy. The first room I was given had black stains streaked on the white comforter. The second room had large chip crumbs on the floor between the beds and a towel tossed on the rack in the shower. If the beds had not been made I would have thought that the room wasn't cleaned after the prior guest. On the second night of my stay the fire alarm went off at 3am. I found it strange that there were no hotel employees to guide guests out of the building or to announce that the issue was cleared and that everyone could return to their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The lady is a little dated”
Reviews.Author: SmilinRic
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Memphis is like the pretty girl from school you see at the reunion. Still looks pretty good, just starting to show her age. The lobby is eye catching, big and airy, large fountain in the center, lobby bar up against two story high windows. But it can look dated and things can look in need of freshening. The front desk staff can be hit of miss. It depends on the time of day, level of business, and if you are recognized as a frequent guest. Take the elevator, any of the four, and youâ€™ll hear creaks and groans and squeaks on the ride up. But glass wall provides a pleasant view of the area. Once in the rooms, and I have stayed in well over a dozen in last the 4 months, all could use some renovation. The bathrooms are big enough but I am often annoyed with the spotty water pressure in the showers. The carpets universally need replacing as do the drapes. Housekeeping is also hit or miss, and maybe more miss than hit. You never know what they will skip. Sometimes itâ€™s replacing the towels, sometimes itâ€™s the coffee. Once I got back to the room to find the bed left unmade while everything else was done very well. I canâ€™t understand how someone doing a completely rote task like making up a room can vary so much. The restaurant, Rookâ€™s Corner, has a nice breakfast buffet with a good assortment of foods. You can get most diets covered between the buffet and the omelet station. Most of the wait staff is pleasant and accommodating. I had dinner at the lobby bar once but the barkeep was sullen and the noise level was high and Iâ€™ve not tried it again. The gym is another area that is showing its age. Like many Hilton properties, the equipment is from Precor, quality gear. There is also an array of machines and accessories for your workout. But nearly every machine needs maintenance or repair. And, again, the housekeeping is hit or miss. Some days there are towels, some not. The water cooler went empty two days during one stay. Despite my mentioning it to the front desk the first day. As an early riser, when I get in the gym and there is stuff laying about I am comfortable assuming the place was not cleaned overnight. If there were another Hilton in Memphis I would likely be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton - Memphis, TN - 5100 Poplar Ave.”
Reviews.Author: On_The_Fly777
Reviews.Content: Absolutely HORRIBLE. The front desk staff was rude. The room was not the type I confirmed and she (at the front desk) was not about to do anything about it. The room was filthy! The carpet was stained the bed covers were stained. The bathroom floor and bath were dirty. There was a sticky mess on the back of the bathroom door from the top to bottom. I had no confidence that the sheets were clean. We had asked for a roll away, of course they didn't have one so my son ended up sleeping on the floor on pillows. The restaurant downstairs had horrible service. On a Saturday night with a football bowl and a AAA convention in town they had one server. We ordered appetizers and it took more than an hour. Several people complained and other people just got up and left the restaurant. I stay in hotels 150+ nights a year and this was one of the worst experiences I have ever had. I would NEVER stay there again in that filthy place and hope no one else will either, maybe they will get their act together.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is OK”
Reviews.Author: sec062108
Reviews.Content: I usually like Hiltons and this one was OK -- staff is nice but the property itself is a little dated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: gregsgirl95
Reviews.Content: This property has great wow factor right off the bat! The lobby, the lounge, and the decor just grabs you in the best way! We had a good experience in the restaurant and even made friends with the bartender! The only hiccup was some inconsistency with whether or not they offered a shuttle to the meeting location. Got a different story each time. Still great, be sure to ask the waitstaff to show you the ducks!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: bernies_mom
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and courteous, the lobby is beautiful with a huge fountain. Breakfast buffet was very good. Rooms were also very pretty, I had a great view from my room.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuy045
Reviews.Content: We went on a road trip to visit the home town of Elvis (plus) and found this hotel along the way... What a gem! The rooms where so clean and fresh - very impressive! The food was excellent - had a problem with a kids meal which was fixed no hassle at all! The starbucks in the lobby was a nice add on when getting back on the road... The pool was great after a long drive... The kids and I didn't want to leave! Great place great value! The Staff really made the place shine!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: rbaelp
Reviews.Content: Very nice property. Had some updates and looks clean and fresh. Staff was friendly. Food was fare at best. Breakfast is gross. Powdered eggs and cold gravy...Bar in front area closed at 11:00 on a Fridatyand Saturday night even though the hotel was full and there is nothing else with in walking distance. Concierge suite was closed on Saturday??? I guess diamond members don't deserve anything extra on the weekend. Bed and rooms were very nice but doors are thin and hallway noise is a problem in the morning hours. House keeping made the bed and replaced towels....thats it. No vacuum, moving items, replacing glasses, restocking shampoo and stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great All Around Hotel”
Reviews.Author: myscreenname29
Reviews.Content: I travel to Memphis a lot for business and always stay in this hotel. The lobby is nice, the staff is VERY nice and the rooms are clean! The beds are very comfortable. No complaints at all for this property.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Masonpips
Reviews.Content: We left Florida on Saturday, July 5 at 8:30 a.m. After driving 530+ miles we arrived at the Hilton at 6 p.m. We were told there were NO rooms available for at least one hour. No manager was available to talk to as they were busy deal with housekeeping (which was apparently the problem). I tried to use the public restroom to clean up and freshen up and the electric plug did not work at all (attempted to use a curling iron for a little hair help after that many hours in the car). While I was in the bathroom another lady told me that the check-in had been as awful the night before. My husband was told by the check-in clerk, "we were full last night and are full again tonight. I've never seen that happen". #1 - this is a HOTEL, you should expect that and staff accordingly. #2 - not having a manager ON SITE in the lobby to suffer the wrath of many disgruntled customers was unexceptable. We left and went and had dinner and when we returned we did have a room. The elevators took forever both that night and in the morning. The room was fine, nice beds and linens. But the bathroom was less than immaculate (dark lines in the grout), the door only closed if you put your entire body against it to latch (my two small children could not latch it at all) and the light on the desk was burnt out (apparently housekeeping doesn't check lightbulbs). My husband again asked for a manger when we checked in and was told he would be called. At 9:30 p.m. he went BACK to the Lobby and said he'd wait. They sent over the front desk director (who he had spoken with earlier and couldn't do anything) and he stated (again) that he wanted the manager. He finally did get to talk w/this person and we were given complimentary breakfast buffets (which was marginal, runny eggs and luke-warm french toast). Not impresed and honestly I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton steps up”
Reviews.Author: andy_tn
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, all around. From the moment we pulled up to the front door, we felt like the staff was **extremely** attentive, very courteous, and responsive to whatever questions or needs that arose. Room was a very clean, comfortable King bedded room. When an issue arose with a slow draining shower/tub, I called down to guest services and the maintenance guy was there within 5 minutes. Room service breakfast was on-time and delicious, with the exception of a sour glass of skim milk (again, they quickly brought us a fresh glass). I don't expect a stay to be perfect every single time - stuff happens - but it's how the staff responds to the 'problems' that makes the impression in my mind. From the front desk, to room service, to the maid, to the maintenance man -- all were extremely courteous. That's what made our stay at the Hilton Memphis enjoyable. This is a top-notch property.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service & Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdoughan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on March 21st, 2008. First of all, let me say that this is a wonderful place to stay. The lobby is very nice and very modern, with lots of glass, bright colors, a nice fountain, and several LCD TVs to watch while you wait. The front desk staff was very friendly and extrememly helpful, as they went above and beyond to accomodate my needs. I asked for a lower level room, and I was promptly given a room on the main floor, just around the corner from the lobby. This was very convenient for us. The room was great as well. VERY comfortable bed, nice furnishings, and very very clean. Hilton once again lives up to its reputation in this regard. The breakfast buffet is also wonderful, and I would encourage others to add it to your room reservation when you book. They only added $10 total to our bill for 2 breakfast buffets, and I saw that they charge $13 per person if you just go in and order the buffet in person. The cooks were extremely friendly, and the spread for breakfast was quite extensive, with plenty of hot, cooked-to-order food and tons of fresh fruit, etc. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat, and will probably return again the next time I'm in Memphis. If you do the same, you will NOT be disappointed....

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat Hilton Memphis”
Reviews.Author: Tupelodan
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, approximately halfway between downtown Memphis and all the new shopping east of Memphis, right off I-240 at the Poplar East exit. Big glass tube in the sky. Great staff, good food, all the amenities ... and it's got great weekend rates. When I got home I discovered I'd left a hanging bag of clothes in my room. I called them, they checked it out and had the clothes, and shipped them to me the next day. I've stayed here before and I'll certainly keep staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid for business stays”
Reviews.Author: PapaSmurfMichigan
Reviews.Content: This hotel might be nice for a casual traveler - although it is about as far from any attraction as you can get in Memphis - but avoid it if you are a business traveler. The internet connections are awful, certainly not reliable enough to tap into company networks remotely. The fitness center is nothing like the hotels website depicts. Four treadmills, four elipticals, and a rack of dumbells does not constitute a workout room for a hotel of this size. Rooms were clean. Staff pleasant, but not well trained. I came in a conference center door to the rear of the hotel and asked two staffers how to get to the lobby..........neither could tell me. Alot of glitz in the common areas, but not worth the buck if you expect a full service hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: jimvad
Reviews.Content: We got a really cheap rate using their online booking service. It was a non-refundable net rate...try it out!!! We saved a bunch for a great room!!! We stayed on the 10th floor with a view of the east side of the facility. Really nice place...I've always wanted to stay there as we live a little over an hour from Memphis. The lobby area was a happening place as there is a bar with big screen TVs. Easy check-in and the staff was very nice!!! The bell-hop was excellent!!! We had a room-service pizza for dinner (snowed outside so we got to stay in for the night) and it was pretty tasty!!! Everything about this place was nice, including the very comfortable bed!!! We will stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: mjames
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property during a business trip. Check-in was quick and easy. The person who handled my check-in gave me a quick tour of the hotel and walked me to the elevators. The lobby and bar area are very nicely decorated. The work-out room is well equipped. The gift shop has a great supply of everything from snacks to souveniers. The room wasn't as clean as I would have liked (stained carpet, dirt in the corners of the bathroom,etc.) but it was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The entire property is non-smoking, but they do have an outdoor smoking area (terrace with patio furniture) on the lobby level.

Reviews.Title: “First Visit to Memphis”
Reviews.Author: PantherFan09
Reviews.Content: My friends and I (6 total) road tripped it up to Memphis from Orlando for the Liberty Bowl Game. I've only seen pictures of the hotel online. We were totally surprised when we arrived. Very clean, awesome lobby and very friendly help. Rooms are big (enough for 6 shhhhh :) ) and the beds are very comfortable. Only downside was cleaning staff took some glasses we purchased at a near by restaurant but once I told the front desk they "found" them and FedExed them to be overnight but of course arrived broken. Also, booking through Expedia was a disatser. They charged me twice and had to pull teeth to get my money back. Never again Expedia!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: beth059
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The lobby was clean, parking was easy and free, the room was large and the bed was so comfortable. The hotel was in a nice area with easy access to the stadium, Beale Street and the airport. The staff was very friendly. I even had great water pressure in the shower which is sometimes a problem with a packed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in EVERY WAY”
Reviews.Author: GuyanaBoy
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at this fine Hotel, I was truly impressed. When I pulled up to the door, a Bellman was at my car with a cart before I could even get out. I told him I would go check in first and then come get my things, and he stood at my car until I returned. When I walked into the lobby, I was truly impressed with the beauty of the Hotel. It was large and expansive, and had a very elegant look and feel. When I checked in, the checkin was quick and easy. I requested a King Size room and was immediately moved to the room of my choice. I then went back to the car and got my things. I moved my car to the free parking area (Valet was also an option, but I opted to park myself as there was parking right in front of the door.) The Bellman then took me to my room, which was ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL. The room did NOT look like a Hotel room at all. The furnishing were beautiful and the room was decorated to give it a nice "at home" feel. There was a luxurious King Sized Bed, and well laid out work desk with a VERY COMFORTABLE upscale desk chair. (Complete with free, very high speed wireless internet). The room also had a comfortable easy chair with ottoman, lots of lighting, and a LARGE Closet with safe. The bathroom area was large and the double sink was outside the bathroom in a alcove next to the closet. Toilet and tub were in their own "room". The large screen TV would swivel so that you could see it from the Bed, the Chair, or the Desk. I opted to order Room Service for my evening meal. It was delicious and QUICK. (They promised 30 minute delivery and got it to me in about 12 minutes.) I also ordered breakfast to be delivered to my room by placing an order form on the outside doorknob before 1am. I stated the time I wanted breakfast delivered, and it came at exactly the time I ordered. As a side note, when I called Room service to place my order, they answered the phone by asking me how they could help me. . . and by calling me BY NAME! I was truly impressed. The staff at the hotel went out of their way to take care of my every need, and they did this with a smile on the their face, and in their voice. I would HIGHLY recommend this Hotel to anyone that is looking for an Oasis in the city of Memphis. Their service, Location, decor, and sense of style were excellent in every way. I will ABSOLUTELY use this Hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Thought this was a very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SCP_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Thanksgiving holidays. The hotel was very nice, and the staff was particularly helpful and polite. I will certainly stay here again on a trip to east Memphis. The only problem we encountered was that the large floor to ceiling windows in the rooms collected alot of condensation on the inside and kept the edges of the carpet damp. This should be addressed by the management.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...staff very rude”
Reviews.Author: MW1Wx
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during Elvis week with my wife. The front desk staff could not tell us anywhere close by where we could get something to eat. The bar man was the rudest I have ever encountered, we asked him did the bar do food he said yes and walked away. When he came back over we had to ask him for a menu he proceeded to throw one at me and grunt. We asked the bell man for a taxi to gracelands, he lined up one of his buddy's with a so called limo and charged us twice the price of a taxi. Food in the hotel was average at best rooms were clean. I would recommend hiring a car because this hotel is along way from anywhere by the talk of the staff anyway!!

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave the room!”
Reviews.Author: shakiralovejamison
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my room! There was not one thing that I didn't like. I had an awesome view from my 20th floor room. The beds ( I got a room with a double bed, even though it was just me) were so comfortable I felt like I was sinking into the feathers. The bathroom/vanity was beautiful and clean. The staff were okay, I didn't hear much from them after I checked in. The lobby is gorgeous and the pool area was a blast for my little cousins that I took swimming there. Overall, I would love to return. Oh...and I got a great deal on my room with AAA.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let them put you on the first floor-overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Business-traveler4
Reviews.Content: Avoid the first floor. Stayed there on business for one night. I had just had a long flight having been delayed at the airport for three hours because of weather. I was ready to rest but the room that they put me in smelled strong of mildew or mold and had roaches running around. I complained and they told me that they were booked and couldn't move me. I complained more and they said that they would move me up. They then moved me to another room on the same floor a couple of doors down and the room still had an overwhelming smell (the whole floor had a smell. Probably because it is by the water). I complained again because I have bad allergies and I was already starting to have breathing problems. They told me again that they were totally booked and couldn't move me up. I finally got them to move me on another level where it was much better. There was still a loud vent in my room but finally after an hour of getting there, I had a room I could breath in. Breakfast was overpriced. Cost me almost $25 for ham, eggs, toast and juice. They have a business office where you can use a fax or computer but it will cost you quite a bit. Otherwise, it looks really nice from the outside and in the lobby. The beds are comfortable. The staff was, for the most part, friendly and helpful. If it had been my choice, I would stay somewhere much cheaper where you get a free hot breakfast with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but could improve”
Reviews.Author: johnathome
Reviews.Content: Was in Memphis for a client event. First time at this Hilton and probably my last. Arrived at airport and called hotel to pick-up shuttle bus. Was told to wait by curb...waited and waited. Finally called and found out that he had left. Took a cab from the airport as didnt want to wait. Check-in was fast and efficient. Had a fax waiting for me which they mentioned when I checked in. When I got to my room, noticed that I had gotten two doubles instead of the king that I booked. Called downstairs, they apologized and told me that they only had doubles remaining. Wished they told me at check-in. Room was comfortable but bathroom was tiny and looked worn. Rest of the room looked neat. The A/C was loud but the tv and other appliances worked fine. They had a free bottle of water in the room which was nice. Didn't have dinner at the hotel but did get coffee and some fruit for breakfast in the lobby. With only one person working, it wasnt the fastest breakfast. The gym was tiny for such a large hotel. 3 treadmills, 1 step machine and a universal machine. One of the treadmills didnt work. 2 televisions and 2 clocks which were both set with the wrong time? Not impressed for a business hotel. Overall, ok for a few night stay. There are better options in this area (Embassy Suites)

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: provi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Memphis for 3 nights in total. The room was clean and quite spacious with loads of towels. Well stocked toiletries. The staff were helpful and friendly. The only problem was the air/con - either too hot or too cold but it was unseasonably cold outside. Big plus was the Starbucks bar downstairs with reasonably priced coffee and granola / health bars etc which made a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Wow, Wow”
Reviews.Author: Segalini
Reviews.Content: The hotel is immaculate, the staff was cool but efficient, the rooms are wonderfully decorated and up to date. Although the distance to downtown was about 15 minutes, the location is easy and this hotel is so worth it. The price was awesome. STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: septemberseptember
Reviews.Content: Wasn't too impressed with the hotel. Only had 30 something channels on the TV. Pamphlets in the room looked like they had been there for years. Everything seemed very overpriced. Check out is very easy though - Just call the front desk and say your leaving and leave your keys in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Carpet should be replaced”
Reviews.Author: Housekeep_Scrutiny
Reviews.Content: Hotel has undergone a beautiful renovation; however, the cleanliness is lacking. The floor in my bathroom was not clean, and the carpet was terribly stained in several areas. One lamp bulb was out and the tv's are old. The bedding was clean though.
